bde 'o bde 'o dngos med bde/ / zhen pa med pas dngos med bde/ / rtogs pa thams cad der shes bde/ / sgrub bya med pa'i gsang ba bde/ ! / spyi bo pad+ma 'dab skyes su/ / sa bon g.yo ba dga' ba ste/ / snying ga mgrin pa mchog tu dga'/ / lhan skyes khyad dga' bla med thob/ ! /

Bliss! Bliss! Immaterial bliss! Devoid of clinging, immaterial bliss! Bliss—every thought recognized as bliss! Bliss—the secret of nothing to be attained. [Babhahi] In the petaled lotus of the crown, The motile seed leads to joy. In the heart and throat, supreme joy, And then the unsurpassed coemergent and special joys.[36] [Nalina]

bdag gis ma rtogs bar du ro la khyad dga' che/ / de bzhin 'khor ba dag dang sangs rgyas khyad par chi/ / rtogs pa'i dus na 'khor 'das bde ba chen po ste/ / dper na rgya mtsho'i nang na 'bar ba'i rin chen bzhin/ ! /

Until one is realized, one loves to experience different tastes, And that’s the great distinction between samsara and buddhahood. But once realization is attained, samsara and nirvana are great bliss, Like a precious jewel shining in the ocean’s depths. [Shāntideva]

dus kyi sna rtse'i bdag byin rlabs dang mi ldan na/ / phyi nang kun tu spyod pa dag gis 'tshang mi rgya/ / dga' bde'i rang bzin sangs rgyas dag dang khyad par med ni/ / zhen pa btang na rang bzhin skyes pa'i nyams myong mchog tu 'gyur/ ! /

If one does not have the blessings at the crucial time, Outer and inner conduct will not lead to enlightenment. There is no difference between joyous bliss and the buddhas; When one abandons clinging, supreme experience will naturally arise. [Indrabhūti]

bla ma dag las dang por rang gi sems rtogs bya/ / de nas rnam pa kun tu tha dad med bya ste/ / gnyis med goms pas dur khrod gnas su 'dug par bya/ / mnyam par rtogs na smyon pa'i brtul zhugs spyod par bya/ ! /

The teachers say, “First realize the nature of your mind. After that, make no distinctions in any way: Get used to nonduality and stay in charnel grounds. When you’ve realized sameness, lead a madman’s way of life.” [Mekopa]

bde sdug thams cad sems las byung*/ / gdams pas sems kyi ri bo brkos/ / sa yi ri bo brkos gyur kyang*/ / gnyug ma'i bde chen thob mi 'gyur/ / tha mal shes pa snying gi dbus su sad/ / tshogs drug dag na bde chen rgyun mi chad/ / brtags pa thams cad don med sdug bsngal rgyu/ / sgom dang mi sgom gnyug ma'i ngang du zhog ! /

The source of all happiness and pain is mind, So use the teachings to excavate the mountain of the mind. However much one toils to dig away a mountain made of earth, The great bliss of the natural state will never be attained. Wake up the “ordinary” mind in the center of your heart; When the six senses are purified, the flow of great bliss never stops. There’s no point in analysis; it’s all a source of suffering. Whether you are meditating or not, rest in the natural state. [Togchepa]

rang bzhin lus kyi so mal du/ / dran rig rnam rtog sol ba la/ / lA lA rA sa'i sbud pas bus/ / d+hU ti ye shes me spar nas/ / dug gsum rnam rtog chos skur brdungs/ / kaM b+ha ri pas rtogs nas grol/ ! /

My body is a blacksmith’s forge,[37] My thoughts and concepts burning coals; The right- and left-hand veins are bellows, Blowing the central, wisdom, vein ablaze To forge the ultimate body of truth By hammering out defiling thoughts. I am Kamparipa, the smith Who realized this and thus was freed. [Kamparipa]
khams gsum lus ngag yid gsum gyi/ / dran rig rnam rtog sna tshogs kun/ / lA lA rA sa d+hU ti ru/ / bdag byin rlabs phyir bcing bar bgyi/ ! /
In order that I bless myself I will bind in the right, left, and central veins All the thoughts and concepts of the triple world Related to my body, speech, and mind. [Jālandhara] {92}
phyi yi sgra gcan bzang po yis/ / zla ba'i snang ba gnyis med thos/ / kun rdzob zla ba'i thig le ni/ / dbyings rig sgra gcan gnyis med zos/ ! /

The planet Rāhu outside Eclipses the light of the moon, And the two are no longer there. The Rāhu of space and awareness Eclipses the lunar circle of relative phenomena, And duality disappears.[38] [Rāhula]
snang srid chos kyi kong bu ru/ / byang chub sems kyi mar khu blug / tshogs drug rnam shes sdong bu la/ / gnyis med ye shes me spar bas/ / rnam rtog 'khrul pa'i mun pa bcom/ ! /

Pour the oil of the awakening mind Into the lamp of the phenomenal world, And light the wick of the six consciousnesses With the flame of nondual gnosis, To banish the darkness of deluded thought. [Dharmapa]
chos dbyings rang bzhin snod dag tu/ / rig pa chos sku'i rdzas nyid bcug / dbyings rig gnyis med 'bras bu ni/ / skal ldan rnal 'byor rig pas bcug ! /

In the bowl that is the expanse of reality Place the ingredients—awareness, the body of truth. A fortunate practitioner, with awareness, Realizes the fruit of expanse and awareness inseparable. [Dhokaripa]
rig pa gnyug ma'i shes rab dang*/ / nyams myong goms pa'i thabs dag gis/ / rang bzhin gnas lugs gzhi dag las/ / bde chen lhun grub 'bras bu rtogs/ ! /

With the wisdom of the natural state, awareness, And the skillful means of training in experience, From the pure ground of the natural way things are The spontaneous result of great bliss is realized. [Medhina]
ji ltar bla mas ma zin ma rtogs dus dag tu/ / yid bzhin nor bu dang ni nor bu mching bu mnyam/ / bla ma dang ni rtogs pas yongs su zin gyur na/ / nyi zla'i 'od dang srin bu me khyer ji bzhin no/ ! /

To one without a teacher and with no realization The wishing gem and a cheap trinket look the same. But under a teacher’s guidance, once realization is gained, They are as different as the light of sun and moon and a firefly’s glow. [Saṅkaja]
lA lA rA sa d+hU ti gsum/ / bdag byin brlab phyir bcing bar bya/ / bla ma sems dang snang ba gsum/ / rtogs pa bskyed phyir mkhas pas bsten/ ! /
In order to bring blessings on oneself, One binds the right, left, and central veins. In order to give rise to realization, The wise attend to teacher, mind, and appearances. [Ghaṇḍhapa]
mar me'i rtse mo lta bu yi/ / phra zhing gsal ba'i yid goms pas/ / brtan zhing g.yo ba'i dngos po kun/ / chos kyi dbyings su rnam par thim/ ! /
It is by training the ordinary mind, Which is as bright and subtle as the tip of a flame, That all things, the animate and inanimate, Dissolve into the expanse of reality. [Yogipa]
bla ma dam pa'i gdams ngag ni/ / yun ring dus su bsgom pa yis/ / sa sogs rim par thim pa las/ / rang snang phyag rgya chen por 'gyur/ ! /

When one has meditated for great lengths of time On the holy teacher’s words of advice, One by one, earth and the other elements dissolve, And thence one’s own perceptions transform into the Great Seal. [Chaluki]
phyi nang chos kun sems su 'dus/ / sems nyid gsal ba'i don rtogs na/ / spyod lam rnam bzhi chos kyi sku/ / rtogs pa mngon gyur rdzogs sangs rgyas/ ! /

All outer and inner phenomena are gathered in the mind, And mind itself is clarity. When this is realized, The four modes of conduct are realized as the body of truth. Such realization is perfect buddhahood. [Gorura]
gang zhig thog ma med dus nas/ / 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho yun ring 'khyams/ / bla ma dam pa'i gru dag gis/ / brgal dka'i mtsho las de ring thar/ ! /
One who, since beginningless time, Was drifting in samsara’s sea, So hard to cross, today is saved By that great ship, the holy guide. [Luchika]
chu rlabs lta bu'i nyams brtan nas/ / spyod par bags kyis 'gro bar bya/ / bla ma dam pa'i gdams ngag gis/ / chags sdang rtog pa rang zhir byas/ ! /
Stabilize experiences, which are like waves, And then proceed with conduct, step by step. With the advice the holy teacher gives, Desire and hatred will naturally subside. [Naguṇa] {93}
ye shes rig pa'i ting nge 'dzin/ / thad ka ma de gnyug mar gnas/ / ji ltar rtogs na nges pa yin/ / rnam rtog dran pa de nyid min/ ! /
The concentration that knows primordial wisdom Dwells on the natural state from the very beginning.[39] To realize this, as it is, is certainty. Concepts and memories are not that state. [Jayānanti]
gang yang ma blta dbus su ltos/ / mchog dang dga' bral bde ba che/ / sngags kyi gsang ba'i stobs dpyad na/ / rnal 'byor rigs kyis bsdu bar bya/ ! /
Not looking anywhere, look at the center: Supreme joy, absence of joy, great bliss! If one examines the secret power of mantra, It is subsumed in the yogi’s buddha nature. [Pachari]
thabs dang shes rab 'od gsal lta bu la/ / bla ma chu bo'i rgyun gyis kun la khyab/ / lhan cig skyes pa dpag bsam shing dag la/ / 'bras bu sku gsum rang gsal rab tu rdzogs/ ! /

Like the clear light of means and wisdom, The stream of the teacher’s blessings permeates all. On the wish-fulfilling tree of the innate, The radiant fruits of the three bodies are complete. [Champaka]
bla med bgrod dka'i byang chub gnas chen du/ / zung 'jug bde ba chen po'i lam bstan nas/ / phyogs cha bral ba'i rnal 'byor dbang phyug mchog / bla ma'i gdams pa'i drin gyis de ltar rtogs/ ! /

Following the path of the union Great Bliss To the sacred land of highest enlightenment, so difficult to reach, The supreme lord of yogis, free of partiality, Attains realization through the teacher’s kindness and advice. [Bhikṣhana]
bdag nyid gdod nas sangs rgyas la/ / rtogs pa'i dbang gis chos nyid yin/ / dbang blangs lhan cig skyes pa des/ / skye med rgyas 'debs rje bo 'dzin/ ! /

From the very beginning, I am enlightened: Because of my realization, everything is ultimate reality. With the innate [wisdom] received through empowerment I affix the seal of the unborn, Vajradhara.[40] [Dhilipa]
rgyu mthun las kyi 'khor lo yis/ / srid pa'i zlos gar sna tshogs byas/ / ye shes rig pa'i me yis ni/ / 'khrul pa'i dri ma ma lus bsregs/ ! /
The self-perpetuating wheel of deeds Produced the manifold drama of the world. The fire of primordial wisdom and awareness Has consumed all delusion and impurity. [Kumbharipa]
sangs rgyas kun gyi sdom pa mchog / rang gis rtogs pas gzhan med de/ / gnyug ma sems nyid rtogs pa gang*/ / sangs rgyas thams cad des mthong yin/ ! /
The supreme commitment of all the buddhas, Realized by oneself, is nothing other than Realization of the natural state, the nature of mind, And with it the vision of all the buddhas. [Charpaṭipa]
gang zhig ma rtogs dus kyi tshe/ / rnam rtog sna tshogs sgra phyir dbrengs/ / de nyid rang bzhin mngon gyur tshe/ / gang snang rang bzhin de de nyid/ ! /
As long as one is not realized, All kinds of thoughts chase after sounds. When one has realized the nature of thatness, All that appears is by nature thatness. [Maṇibhadrā]
phyi dang nang kun sems su 'dus/ / zhen pa med na ro snyoms ldan/ / 'bad rtsol med na sgom pa'i mchog / gnyis med bde chen rdzogs sangs rgyas/ ! /

Everything, without, within, is gathered in the mind, And when it is free of clinging, all is of even taste. To be without effort is the highest meditation. Nondual great bliss is perfect buddhahood. [Mekhali]
go cha chen po bgos nas kyang*/ / nor bu lta bu'i snying stobs kyis/ / rang gis sems kyi gru btang nas/ / mi ro'i khog par nges bar zhugs/ ! /
Donning the [bodhisattva’s] great armor, With jewel-like determination One sets sail in the boat of one’s mind And is certain to enter a human corpse. [Kanakhalā][41]
chos dbyings rnam dag mkha' dkyil du/ / skye med 'brug sgra legs bsgrags pas/ / snang srid 'khrul pa'i chos rnams kun/ / sku gsum ye shes 'bras bus mdzes/ ! /
In the pure firmament of the expanse of reality The thunder of the unborn resounds: All the world’s delusory phenomena Are beautified by the result—the gnosis of the three bodies. [Kalakala] {94}
bla ma dam pa'i khab dag dang*/ / snying rje yi ni skud pa yis/ / khams gsum ma lus gos su btsems/ / gos kyi rnal 'byor ngo mtshar che/ ! /
With the needle of the sacred guide And the thread of compassion, I sewed the yogi’s marvelous cloth, Clothing all the beings in the three worlds. [Kandhalipa]
zung 'jug rig pa rin chen mdzod/ / gnyis med ngang der btsal bas min/ / bya ba btang ba'i sems bzhin du/ / ji ltar bzhag pa de bzhin bde/ ! /
The precious treasure of union awareness, The state of nonduality, is not something that can be sought. Give up activity, and in that state of mind, Settling there, you will find bliss. [Dhahulipa]
ji ltar rnam rtog rjes 'brang 'khrul/ / ma 'brengs bag chags ma btang bzung*/ / gang la mi gnas 'gro ba bsdu/ / gzhan las btsal bas de rnyed min/ ! /
Following thoughts, one is deluded. Make not following them a habit, and do not give it up. Dwelling nowhere, gather in all movements: You will not find anything by looking elsewhere. [Udhilipa]
dngos kun gnyis med rdo rje 'dzin/ / rgyan sogs thod pa blo bur ba/ / ngar 'dzin 'khrul pa de nyid kyang*/ / rang gis btsal bas rnyed ma yin/ ! /

ji srid ma rtogs bar du rang bzhin rtog pas bcings/ / de tsho rtogs par gyur na rang bzhin gnyis ma grub/ / des na sangs rgyas zhes bya rang gi blo brtags yin/ / de nyid spros bral ma bcos rang sar rang sems bzung*/ ! /

Until one gains realization, one is fettered by concepts of self and others. When realization is achieved, self and others no longer exist. So-called buddha is one’s own intellectual label. Without elaboration or contrivance, settle the mind in its own state. [Kiravalapa]

'gro rnams sdug bsngal gyis gdungs la/ / 'dod yon dag gi char phab bo/ / de bzhin nyid kyi gnas chen du/ / rig pa'i klu rgyal nyid gzir nas/ / skal ldan rig 'dzin pho mo la/ / gsang sngags rig pa'i char phab bo/ ! /

On the people tormented by suffering A rain of all good things was showered down. In the sacred land of suchness, On fortunate male and female vidyādharas Who have coerced the nāga king of awareness, A rain of secret mantra awareness is showered down.[42] [Sakarapa]

bdag gis ma rtogs dus na sna tshogs ro la khyad par che/ / gang zhig rtogs pa'i dus su ro rnams ngo bo bye brag med/ / de bzhin ma rtogs nyid na 'khor 'das tha dad snang*/ / de nyid rtogs na 'khor ba sangs rgyas bde ba che/ ! /

For one who has no realization, different flavors are quite distinct. When one is realized, flavors are in essence no different. So too, when one is not realized, samsara and nirvana appear to be distinct. For one who realizes thatness, samsara is buddhahood, great bliss. [Sarvabhakṣhapa]
sa la gnas na thams cad skal pa bzang*/ / rgya mtsho'i gting du phyin na dbul dang bral/ / ral gri lag tu thogs na longs spyod che/ / phyogs med dag tu phyin na gnyen dang 'phrad/ ! /

If one lives on the earth, everything is good fortune. If one reaches the depths of the sea, one is never poor. If one brandishes a sword, one has great wealth. If one comes to those without partiality, one meets with friends. [Nāgabodhi]

bde ba chen po rang la yod kyang ma rtogs 'khrul pas sgribs/ / bde gsal 'dod pas bsod nams ye shes tshogs bsags bya/ / tshogs gnyis ma bsags skye ba brgya ru 'bad byas kyang*/ / bla ma chen po dag dang mi ldan bde ba chen po rtogs mi 'gyur/ ! /

Great bliss is present in us, but we do not know that; it is hidden by delusion. Those who wish for bliss and clarity must gather merit and wisdom. Those who fail to accumulate these two may live a hundred lives of toil, But, lacking a great teacher, they will never realize great bliss. [Dārikapa]

thams cad bde gshegs rang bzhin te/ / blos bzhag log pa'i lam spangs te/ / snying po'i lam la brtson byas pas/ / snying po'i 'bras bu gdon mi za/ / gang gi bla ma dam pa las/ / dbang rnams lhan cig skyes pa de/ / ro yi kun la khyab byas te/ / skye med rgyas 'debs rdo rje 'dzin/ ! /

All is the nature of sugata; Give up wrong paths based on intellect {95} And strive on the essential path: There is no doubt you will get the essential fruit. Those who take empowerment from a holy teacher Are entirely pervaded by the flavor Of the coemergent wisdom, Affixing the seal of the unborn, Vajradhara. [Putalipa]
snying po gnyug ma'i don bsam pas/ / ji ltar bsam pa de ltar rtogs/ / des na de nyid rang dgar yin/ / 'dod rgu lhug par thams cad 'byung*/ ! /
In reflecting on the essence, the meaning of the natural state, What you reflect on is what you will realize. That is all there is to it, And all you wish for will come effortlessly. [Pahanapa]
bya ba btang na man ngag yin/ / zhe bdod med pa rtogs pa yin/ / bde ba dngos med sgom pa yin/ / bsgrub bya med na 'bras bu'i mchog ! /
To give up activity is the pith instruction. To be without hope is realization. Bliss without substantiality is meditation. Nothing to accomplish is the supreme result. [Kokilapa]

'khor ba snying po med pa yi/ / 'ja' tshon lta bu'i lus 'di la/ / ma rig mngon zhen dregs pa yi/ / dug gis zin nas bde bar 'dzin/ / mngon zhen dug nad spangs pa na/ / 'khor ba nyid kyang chos kyi sku/ ! /

All samsara is hollow, essenceless,[43] Yet, poisoned by ignorance, attachment, and pride, We cling to this body like a rainbow And believe that we are happy. Once our poisoning by attachment is cured, Samsara is itself the body of truth. [Anonga]
dang por blo ldan rtogs pa skyes/ / bar du gnas lugs ma yengs bsgom/ / de nas nyams myong skyes pa na/ / spyod pa bags kyis spyad par bya/ ! /
First, the wise develop realization, Then they meditate, undistracted from the actual way things are. After that, as their experience grows, They should engage in conduct gradually. [Lakṣhmīnkarā]
skye med rtogs kyang nyams myong dang bral na/ / dper na srin po'i lag tu bu khyer 'dra/ / nyams myong gnas lugs dag dang ma 'brel na/ / de yang glang chen 'dam du zhugs pa 'dra/ ! /

One who has realized the unborn but has no experience Is like an ogress with a baby in her arms. One whose experience is not related to the actual way things are Is like an elephant mired in a swamp. [Samudrapa]
bla ma dam pa mthong na de nyid mthong*/ / nam mkha'i mthongs su sgom na dben pa'i mchog / chos rnams yongs su rtogs na mi mthun med/ / nam mkha'i 'o ma 'thung na 'tsho bar 'gyur/ /

To see the holy teacher is to see thatness. To meditate on the sky’s expanse is the highest solitude. To fully realize the nature of phenomena is to be free of conflict. To drink the milk of space is to find your sustenance. [Vyālipa]
de ltar gsung gi gdams pa so sor stsal bar mos mdzod/
Consider that you have been given each of these instructions.

slar yang bdag la byin gyis brlab tu gsol snyam du mos gus drag po byas pa'i rkyen gyis/ bla ma grub thob rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug brgyad cu rtsa bzhi po thams cad sku 'od phung gi rnam par ltem gyis zhu nas khyed rang la sib kyis thim pas sku gsung thugs kyi byin rlabs thams cad spar btab pa bzhin thugs rgyud la 'phos pa'i mos pa mdzod/

Again, think that you are requesting blessings, and consider that as a result of your intense devotion, the teacher and all the eighty-four siddhas, the lords of yogis, gradually melt into a mass of light and dissolve into you. All the blessings of their body, speech, and mind are transferred into your mind as if imprinted on it.
ces maN+Dal rdul tshon nas tshom bu sogs mgo bor 'jog cing dril bu gsil/ ngag tu/
With this, place a few grains from the colored sand mandala on the disciples’ heads and ring the bell. As you do so, say: {96}
spyir 'phags yul du byon pa'i grub thob pho mo'i tshogs ma lus shing lus pa med pas byin gyis rlobs shig /
All you hosts of male and female siddhas who appeared in India, every one of you without exception, grant your blessings.
khyad par rnal 'byor dbang phyug chen po lU yi pa la sogs pa brgyad cu rtsa bzhis rdo rje slob ma 'di rnams la byin gyis rlobs shig /
And in particular, all you eighty-four great lords of yogis, Lūyipa and the others, grant your blessings on these vajra disciples.
lus la rdo rje'i sku'i sgo nas byin gyis rlobs shig / ngag la rdo rje gsung gi sgo nas= yid la rdo rje thugs kyi sgo nas byin gyis rlobs shig / yon tan mi zad pa rgyan gyi 'khor lo'i sgo nas=
Bless their bodies with the vajra body. Bless their speech with the vajra speech. Bless their minds with the vajra mind. Bless them with the wheel of the ornaments of inexhaustible qualities.
phrin las rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas= gsang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sgo nas= da lta nyid du= myur ba nyid du=
Bless them with the four activities. Bless them with the inconceivable secret. Bless them this very moment. Bless them quickly.
stan thog 'di nyid du byin gyis rlobs shig /
Bless them in this very session.
dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH
jaḥ hūṁ baṃ hoḥ
des sgo gsum 'pho ba'i sgrib pa dag / dbang bzhi pa thob/ ye shes rdo rje'i byin rlabs zhugs pa'i mos pa mdzod cig /
With this, consider that the obscurations preventing the transformation of the three doors are purified, you receive the four empowerments, and the blessings of the vajra gnosis enter you.
de dag gis grub chen brgyad cu rtsa bzhi'i byin rlabs chabs cig tu grub pa lags/
You have now received the blessings of the eighty-four great siddhas all together.

'dir yid ma gtod pa'i tshul du mi g.yo ba'i rjes gnang bya srol 'dug pa ma byas kyang chad skyon med la bya bar 'dod na 'dir sbyar/ de'ang lugs srol gang bde chog mod kyang*/ phyag rgyun tu rdo rje gdan pa'i thugs dam lha drug gi nang tshan nyid sbyor bar mdzad do/ /

At this point, it is customary to give the authorization empowerment of Achala by way of introducing the disciples to a yidam deity, but there is no fault in omitting it. However, if you wish to do so, give it here. For this, you may use whichever tradition is convenient, but the usual practice is to give the empowerment from Dorje Denpa’s six yidam deities.[44]
mthar bka' sdod chos skyong gi byin rlabs ni/ mgon po gri gug gi mngon rtogs mdor bsdus tsam gyi chog mod/ 'brug pa'i yig char phyag bzhi par mdzad pa'i rgyun bzhugs pa ltar na/

At the end, bestow the blessings of the attendant dharma protector. For this you can simply use the concise daily practice of the Protector with the Curved Knife (Gönpo Triguk), but you may also do so according to the customary practice with the four-armed Gönpo found in the Drukpa Kagyu texts, as follows:

Next, to receive the blessings of the Glorious Wisdom Lord, the protector of the Vajrayāna teachings who attends the mahāsiddhas, concentrate on the following. This mandala in front, which is the basis of appearance, is a boundlessly vast buddha field, the Unexcelled Display of the Great Secret, completely surrounded by a protection circle. Inside it, in the center of a terrifying charnel ground, on a throne of lotus, sun, and the corpses of liberated enemies and obstacle makers, is the Great Glorious Wisdom Protector (Mahākāla), his color as black as the clouds and darkness at the end of the kalpa. Short and corpulent, with his belly hanging down and thick limbs, he has a single wrathful face and four arms. He rolls his three eyes, {97} which are round and red, like sparks of fire. His mustache, eyebrows, and beard are orange, emitting a fiery light. Of his four hands, the first on the right displays the gesture of supreme giving, and the second holds a blazing fiery sword. The first left hand holds a skull cup full of blood, while the second brandishes a trident draped with silks and a small hand drum. He has a crown of five dried-out human skulls topped with a black vajra. He is wearing a long necklace of fifty freshly severed heads dripping blood, and he is adorned with venomous snakes and bone ornaments. His lower garment is a fresh tiger skin. He sits with his two legs in different postures of royal ease, with one leg stretched out and the other bent. He manifests in the middle of a fiercely blazing mass of wisdom fire in the form of the utterly terrifying, great glorious heruka, the sovereign of the wrathful ones. All the haughty spirits of the three worlds bow down to him. In his presence, consider your body, the aggregates that result from the ripening of your karma, and imagine that the top of your head is sliced off [to form a skull cup], into which the whole of the rest of your body is put. As I say oṁ āḥ hūṁ, it melts completely into wisdom nectar, which is white with a red luster and endowed with a hundred tastes. Consider that Mahākāla drinks it, drawing it up through his vajra tongue, which is in the form of tube-like rays of light. Repeat after me: This deliciously prepared food offering, Bewitching with its hundred tastes, I offer with faith to venerable Mahākāla. May all these beings have the fortune to enjoy the food of concentration.

This way [of conferring blessings] is not something I thought up and invented for convenience and ease of implementation. Rather, I was fortunate enough to receive the specific approval of my lord Jamyang Khyentse Wangpo, who is inseparable from the great charioteers of India, to make this arrangement in accord with the instructions he received in a pure wisdom vision from the mahāsiddha Lvavapa (Kambala)—the one who wears a woolen cloak. Accordingly, I, Karma Ngawang Yönten Gyatso, took as a basis the tradition and practices of the first and second Jonang Jetsuns, uncorrupted by the stains of compounded confusion, and made this clear arrangement in the dharma college of Tashi Lhatse at Dzongsar. By following the path of the unsurpassable mantras as instructed, They attained the union state beyond training in one body, one life: At the lotus feet of the yogis and yoginīs who attained supreme accomplishment Respectfully I bow down: bless my stream of being. Simply hearing their names brings great benefit, So if we venerate and pray to them with faith, They will free us from the bonds of existence and peace and effortlessly bestow the two accomplishments. Rid of all doubt, I will here explain this point.

The way to perform a detailed accumulation of merit, making offerings and praying to the eighty-four mahāsiddhas according to the tradition of Āchārya Vīraprabhāsvara, comprises a practice in three sections, similar to the general sections for a veneration of the teacher described by Jetsun Tāranātha: the preparation, which consists of setting out the ritual articles and offerings; the main practice, comprising the stages for accumulating merit; and the conclusion, in which one receives the blessings, dissolves the visualization, and so on.

First, the preparation. In a quiet, pleasant location, clean the venue and decorate it with whatever you can collect in the way of canopies, victory banners, and so forth. In a central position, put up a painting of the hundred siddhas. In front of it, set up an altar covered with a cloth, and in the middle of it arrange a tripod or a high table on which you should place the mandala. In front, set out a hundred or so each of the two water offerings and, if you have them, of flowers, incense, lamps, scented water, {103} and food offerings. If you do not have so many, arrange three sets of offerings or just a single set. If they are available, set out two- or three-dimensional images representing the offerings such as forms, sounds, smells, flavors, and physical sensations; the auspicious objects and symbols; the seven attributes of royalty; the sixteen offering goddesses; and so on. If you don’t have these, they can be visualized. Gather the inner offering—a skull cup of nectar—and whatever offerings you can for the feast offering. In front of you prepare the finest precious mandala, clean grains for the piles, a conch filled with pure ablution water, the ingredients from a cow[2] and scented water, the offering mandala, vajra and bell, and the different musical instruments.

Blessing the scented water: oṁ vajra udake hūṁ svāhā.

me tog byin rlabs ni/ oM na mo b+ha ga wa te puSh+pe ke tu rA dzA ya ta thA ga tA ya/ ar+ha te sa mya ka sa mUd+d+hA ya/ tad+yathA/ oM puSh+pe puSh+pe ma hA puSh+pe/ su pu Sh+pe puSh+pe saM b+ha we puSh+po ta b+ha we puSh+pa girne swA hA/ lan gsum mam bdun brjod/

Blessing the flowers: say three or seven times: oṁ namo bhagavate puṣpa ketu rājāya tathāgatāya arhate samyaksambuddhaya tadyaṭhā oṁ puṣpe puṣpe mahāpuṣpe supuṣpe puṣpe saṃbhave buṣpotbhave puṣpa girṇe svāhā.
ba byung sogs byin rlabs ni/ oM go ye swA hA/
Blessing the ingredients from a cow and so on: oṁ gomaye svāhā.
bgegs sbyang ba ni/ oM badz+ra sa twa bi g+hA nu sA ra ya hU~M phaT/
Cleansing away obstacle makers: oṁ vajra sattva vighnanu sāraya hūṁ phaṭ.
maN+Dal re kha bri/ oM badz+ra re khA+e swA hA/
Designing the mandala: oṁ vajra rekhe svāhā

ba lci chur bcas sbyin pa ste/ byi dor byas pa tshul khrims yin/ / grogs sbur bsal ba bzod pa ste/ / brtson 'grus bya ba byed la brtson/ / bsam gtan der sems ska cig ma/ ri mo legs 'bar shes rab bo/ / pha rol phyin pa drug rnams kyis/ / thub pa'i maN+Dal legs byas pa'o/ /

Generosity in adding cow’s dung and urine, Discipline in cleaning, Patience in removing insects, Diligence in the endeavor one applies, Concentration as one thinks of these, {105} Wisdom in very clear visualization— These are the six transcendent perfections That make the Capable One’s mandala the perfect deed.

'dir ni lus kyi las byas na/ / kha dog gser ltar 'gyur ba dang*/ / nang rnams kun las rnam par grol/ / lha dang mi las ches lhag cing*/ / zla ba lta bu'i gzi brjid can/ / nor dang gser ni phun sum tshogs/ / rgyal po'i rigs dang sangs rgyas pa/ / mchog gi khyim du skye ba nyid/ /

By such physical deeds One’s body will become like gold. One will be completely free from all disease. One will be superior to gods and humans, Be resplendent as the moon, Have perfect and abundant riches and gold, And be born in the supreme house Of a royal family and of the Buddha.

slar yang re khA byas la/ oM badz+ra re khe sarba bud+d+ha a d+hiSh+ThA n+tu swA hA/ chu des maN+Dal bkru/ oM waM swA hA/ maN+Dal phyis la/ oM tsan+d+ra arka bi ma le swA hA/ me tog bkram la/ oM badz+ra sa twa sa ma ya sogs yig brgya brjod/ de nas tshom bu nyer gsum pa rim bzhin bkod pa'i dang po dbus su tshom bu gcig bzhag la/ oM haM su me ru na maH

After this, to make the design, say: oṁ vajra rekhe sarva buddha adhiṣṭhāntu svāhā. Rinse the mandala with the water: oṁ vaṃ svāhā. Wipe the mandala with: oṁ candra arka vimale svāhā. Strew it with flowers and recite the hundred syllables: oṁ vajra sattva samaya…. Then dispose the twenty-three piles in order. Begin by placing one pile in the center, as you say: oṁ haṃ sumeru namaḥ.
shar du/ yaM bi de ha dwi pa na maH lhor/ ri dzam+bu dwIpa na maH nub tu/ laM god nI dwI pa na maH byang du/ waM ku ru dwI pa na maH
In the east: yaṃ videhadvīpa namaḥ. In the south: ri jambudvīpa namaḥ. In the west: laṃ godanīdvīpa namaḥ. In the north: vaṃ kurudvīpa namaḥ.
shar gyi g.yas g.yon gnyis su/ yaHyaHu pa dwI pa na maH lha'i g.yas g.yon/ raHraHu pa dwI pa na maH nub kyi g.yas g.yon/ laHlaHu pa dwA pa na maH byang gi g.yas g.yon/ waHwaHu pa dwI pa na maH

In the east, on the right and left: yaḥ yaḥ upadvīpa namaḥ. In the south, to the right and left: raḥ raḥ upadvīpa namaḥ. In the west, to the right and left: laḥ laḥ upadvīpa namaḥ. In the north, to the right and left: vaḥ vaḥ upadvīpa namaḥ.
nub byang/ laHtu rang+ga rat+na ya na maH lho nub/ raHha sti rat+n+ya na maH shar lhor/ yaHga dza r+ny+na ya na maH byang shar/ waHsti rat+nA yan maH
In the northwest: laḥ tu radga ratnāya namaḥ. In the southwest: raḥ hasti ratnāya namaḥ. In the southeast: yaḥ gaja ratnāya namaḥ. In the northeast: vaḥ stī ratnāya namaḥ.
shar dbus/ yaHkhaD+ga rat+nA ya na maH lho dbus/ raHma Ni rat+nA ya na maH byang dbus/ waHni d+hi rat+nA ya na maH nub dbus/ laHtsakra rat+nA ya na ma:

In the center, to the east: yaḥ gaḍga ratnāya namaḥ. In the center, to the south: raḥ maṇi ratnāya namaḥ. In the center, to the north: vaḥ nidhi ratnāya namaḥ. In the center to the west: laḥ cakra ratnāya namaḥ.
shar/ oM aM tsan+d+ra/ nub/ oM aMH sU r+Ya/
In the east: oṁ aṃ candra. In the west: oṁ āḥ sūrya.
oM oM/ 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zhing 'byor pa tshad med pa kun tu bzang po'i rnam 'phrul las byung ba lta bu mchod pa'i sprin rab 'byams kyi ngo bo nyid na maH
oṁ oṁ The boundless riches of realms, worldly and beyond the world, whose nature is infinite clouds of offerings like those that Samantabhadra magically manifested—namaḥ

bdag gzhan lus ngag yid gsum dus gsum dge ba'i tshogs/ / rin chen kun bzang maN+Dal bzang po'i mchod pa 'di/ / blo yis blangs nas dpal ldan bla ma'i tshogs la 'bul/ / thugs rje'i dbang gis bzhes nas byin gyis brlab tu gsol/ / ces brjod la maN+Dal stegs bu'i dbus su 'jog /

The accumulations of virtue that I and others have gathered with our body, speech, and mind in the three times, This excellent mandala of the most perfect riches, I pledge and offer to the host of glorious teachers. {106} Accept it out of compassion and grant your blessings. Reciting this, place the mandala in the middle of the altar.
rten bskyed pa ni/
The visualization of the support:

maN+Dal 'di nyid dag pa ye shes kyi zhing khams rgya dang tshad yongs su chad pa med pa/ rgyan gyi bkod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang bcas pa/ phyi rol srung ba'i 'khor lo gzhom du med pas yongs su bskor ba'i snying por thar pa chen po'i gzhal med khang rgyu dang bkod pa'i bye brag ngo tshar rmad du byung ba/ dur khrod rol pa'i yo byad dang lha rdzas kyi nyer spyod mtha' klas pas brgyan pa'i dbus su seng ge'i khri chen po pad+ma nyi ma zla ba'i gdan dang bcas pa/ phyi rol phyogs mtshams kun tu so sor 'os pa'i gdan gyi khyad par rnams kyang gsal par gyur/

This mandala is a pure wisdom buddha field of full dimensions and extent, perfect in its adornments and layout, surrounded by an impenetrable outer protection circle. In its center is the measureless palace of great liberation, whose specific materials and architecture are to be marveled and wondered at. It is decorated with infinite charnel ground attributes and celestial offerings. In its center is a great lion throne, with cushions of lotus, sun, and moon. And in all the directions around it are visualized the particular thrones appropriate to each of the siddhas.
tshogs zhing spyan 'dren pa ni/
Inviting the fields of merit:

oM/ khyab bdag dngos po kun gyi ngo bo nyid/ / gnas med 'gro 'ong bral ba nam mkha' bzhin/ / gshegs dang bzhugs pa'i mtshan ma mi mnga' yang*/ / bde chen dgyes pa dpal ldan he ru ka / grub thob pho mo rnam 'byor dbang phyug tshogs/ / bla ma yi dam mkha' 'gro 'khor dang bcas/ / bdag gis dad pas deng 'dir gsol 'debs na/ / dmigs med snying rje'i dbang gis 'dir gsal mdzod/ / skyes mchog gnyis med ye shes spyan can rnams/ / chos kyi sku la gshegs 'byon mi mnga' yang*/ / gzugs sku brtse ba chen po'i rnam 'phrul gyis/ / dad ldan mchod pa'i zhing du gshegs su gsol/ /

oṁ All-pervading lord, the very nature of all things, Without location, free of coming and going, like the sky, Although you are not characterized by coming and staying, Glorious Heruka, you who delight in great bliss, Hosts of male and female siddhas, sovereign yogis and yoginīs, With the teachers, yidam deities, and ḍākinīs, As I pray to you now with faith, Appear here through the power of nonconceptual compassion. Supreme beings, you who have the eye of nondual wisdom, Though in the body of truth there is no departing or arriving, Please manifest out of compassion in the form body: Come, I pray, as the objects of veneration by the faithful.
oM gu ru badz+ra d+ha ra sarba yo ge shwa ra de ba DA ki nI e h+yi badz+ra sa mA dzaH
oṁ guru vajradhara sarva yogeśvara deva ḍākinī ehaye hi vajra samājaḥ
zhes pas tshogs zhing rnams sprin gtibs pa ltar byon te so so'i gdan la bzhugs par bsam/
With this, consider that the fields of merit come like gathering clouds and take their places on their respective seats.

dbus kyi khri steng du rtsa ba'i bla ma khyab bdag rdo rje 'chang chen po sku mdog sngon po zhal gcig phyag gnyis rdo rje dang dril bu thugs kar bsnol bas rang snang gi shes rab ma la 'khyud pa/ zhabs rdo rje'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa/ dar dang rin po che'i rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa/ mtshan dang dpe byad thams cad yongs su rdzogs shing*/ rang la dgyes pa'i zhal 'dzum bag ldan pa/ 'od dang 'od zer gyi tshogs mtha' yas pa 'phro ba'i sku can/

Upon the central throne is my root teacher in the form of the all-pervading lord, the great Vajradhara, blue in color, with one face and two hands crossed at his heart level, holding vajra and bell and embracing his wisdom consort, who is his own manifestation. He is seated with his legs crossed in the vajra posture and is adorned with all the silks and jewel ornaments. {107} He has all the major and minor marks complete and is smiling, naturally joyful. His body radiates infinite lights and rays of light.

mtha' bskor phyogs mtshams rnams su grub pa'i slob dpon chen po lU yi pas thog drangs pa'i rnam 'byor dbang phyug brgyad cu/ sring mo DA ki bzhi dang bcas pa thams cad kyang lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i ye shes kyi gzi 'od phyogs brgyar 'bar bas bzod par dka' ba'i zil can nyi ma'i snying po lta bu/ srid pa gsum zil gyis gnon pa'i lta stangs kyis rab tu dpa' ba'i nyams can/ gsung gsang sngags rdo rje mi shigs pa'i sgra dbyangs rtag tu sgrogs pa/ thugs gnyis su med pa'i ye shes phyag rgya chen po'i ngang du mnyam par bzhag pa las mi g.yo ba/ lhun gyis grub cing rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phrin las kyi rnam par rol bzang mi shes pa can/ dpa' bo dang DA ki rgya mtsho lta bus mchod cing brjod pa dang*/ sa gsum gyi dbang po rnams kyi ri mor byed bzhin pa rnams dgyes pas dgongs te bzhugs pa/ gzhan yang brgyud pa'i bla ma rnams dang*/ yi dam dkyil 'khor gyi lha tshogs/ sangs rgyas byang sems 'phags pa nyan rang*/ chos skyong srung ma thams cad bzhugs par gyur/

In all the directions around him, headed by the great accomplished master Lūyipa, are the eighty mahāsiddhas and the four sister ḍākinīs. All of them are dazzlingly brilliant like the heart of the sun, shining in a hundred directions with the light of the wisdom of coemergent great bliss. They look extremely courageous, with their yogic gaze that overawes the three worlds. Their voices constantly intone the indestructible vajra sounds of the secret mantras. Their minds never waver from meditation in the state of the Great Seal, nondual gnosis. The display of their spontaneous, uninterrupted activities is inexhaustible. Venerated and praised by infinite ḍākas and ḍākinīs, they are joyfully considering the rulers of the three worlds honoring them. As well as them, there are present the lineage teachers, the hosts of deities of the yidam mandalas, the buddhas and bodhisattvas, the noble listeners and solitary realizers, and all the dharma protectors and guardians.
mgon po 'gro ba'i don la byon pa legs/ / bdag gi mchod yon 'di nyid bzhis nas kyang*/ / ji srid mchod pa'i bya ba ma rdzogs par/ / yid 'ong gdan la bde bar bzhugs su gsol/ /
Noble lords, you who have come for the sake of beings, Accept the drinking water I offer, And until I have finished venerating you, Please stay happily on these pleasing thrones.
oM pra wa ra sa rka ra ar+g+haM pra tI ts+tsha swA hA/ ces pas mchod yon phul la/ oM pad+ma A sa na s+t+waM/ ces pas gdan la bzhugs par bsam/
With oṁ pravara sarkara arghaṃ pratīccha svāhā offer the drinking water, and with oṁ padma āsana stvaṃ consider that they take their seats.
phyag 'tshal ba ni/
Paying homage:
gang gi drin gyis bde chen nyid/ / skad cig nyid la 'char ba gang*/ / bla ma rin chen lta bu'i sku/ / rdo rje can zhabs pad la 'dud/ /
Through your kindness Great bliss arises in an instant: Teachers, your bodies are like precious jewels; Vajra holders, at your lotus feet I bow.
yon tan kun gyi gter gyur pas/ / gang gi mtshan tsam dran pas kyang*/ / bdag blo'i rgud pa zhi mdzad pa/ / dpal ldan bla ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
You are treasures of all good qualities: {108} Just thinking of your names Brings peace to our troubled minds. To the glorious teachers I pay homage.
dri mes yon tan rab rgyas pas/ / 'gre kun gtsug gi rgyan gyur pa'i/ / dgos 'dod 'byung ba'i rin po che/ / bla ma'i zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Replete with immaculate qualities, You are the crown ornaments of all beings, Precious sources fulfilling all needs and desires. At the feet of the teachers I pay homage.
blang dor rtogs pa'i snang ba yis/ / 'gro kun mi shes mun sel ba/ / dri med nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor mchog / bla ma'i zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Sublime and stainless suns, You dispel the darkness of all beings’ ignorance With the light of realization of what to adopt and avoid. At the feet of the teachers I pay homage.
bsod nams ye shes bsil zer gyis/ / phan bde'i tshal rab rgyas mdzad pa/ / rnam dag zla ba'i dkyil 'khor mchog / bla ma'i zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Sublime and perfectly pure moons, You make the garden of benefit and happiness blossom With the cooling rays of merit and wisdom. At the feet of the teachers I pay homage.
dam chos bdud rtsi'i sman mchog gis/ / nyon mongs sdug bsngal nad sel ba/ / thabs mkhas 'gro ba'i sman mchog / bla ma'i zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Most skillful of doctors for beings, You cure the ailments of defilements and suffering With the supreme ambrosial medicine of the sacred teachings. At the feet of the teachers I pay homage.
thabs dang shes rab gru chen gyis/ / srid zhi'i rgya mtsho'i mthar sgrol ba/ / stobs ldan 'gro ba'i ded dpon mchog / bla ma'i zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Mighty pilots of all that lives, You ferry beings across the ocean of existence and peace In the great ship of means and wisdom. At the feet of the teachers I pay homage.
gnod pa kun las skyob byed pa/ / phan pa dpag med sgrub mdzad pa'i/ / byams mgon 'gro ba'i gnyen gcig po/ / bla ma'i zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Sole loving protectors of beings, You protect everyone from harm And benefit all on an infinite scale. At the feet of the teachers I pay homage.
stong nyid snying rje zung 'jug pas/ / srid zhi'i mtha' la mi gnas pa'i/ / mya ngan 'das pa mchog brnyes pa/ / skyabs mgon khyed la phyag 'tshal 'dud/ /
Through the union of emptiness and compassion You do not dwell in the extremes of existence or peace. You who have attained supreme nirvana, To you, lords of refuge, I bow down in homage.
pha rol phyin pa bcu rdzogs shing*/ / nyer bzhi rtsa rlung dbang 'dus pas/ / yan lag bcu gnyis rnam 'gags pas/ / sa bcu'i mthar son khyed la 'dud/ /

By completing the ten transcendent perfections And mastering the channels corresponding to the twenty-four [sacred lands] and the winds, You have blocked the twelve links And thus reached the end of the ten levels—to you I bow.
yod min med min gnyis ka min/ / gnyis ka min pa'ang ma yin pa/ / rnam dag zag med chos kyi dbyings/ / spros bral chos sku khyed la 'dud/ /
Not existent, not nonexistent, not both, Nor yet neither— Perfectly pure, untainted expanse of reality, Body of truth free of elaboration, to you I bow.
mtshan dang dpe byad dpal 'bar bas/ / dag pa'i zhing gi gdul bya la/ / rtag par theg mchog chos ston pa/ / bde chen longs sku khyed la 'dud/ /
Shining with the glory of the major and minor marks, You constantly teach the dharma of the Supreme Vehicle To disciples in pure buddha fields. Great bliss, body of perfect enjoyment, to you I bow.
sna tshogs gdul bya'i bsam pa ltar/ / sangs rgyas rnam 'phrul dpag med kyis/ / 'gro kun phan bdes tshim mdzad pa/ / thabs mkhas sprul sku khyed la 'dud/ /

Through infinite buddha manifestations In accordance with the attitudes of different disciples, {109} You satisfy all beings with benefit and happiness. Body of manifestation, skilled in means, to you I bow.
gzugs sku'i rnams 'phrul sna tshogs kyang*/ / de yi rang bzhin 'gyur med pa/ / e ma ho brjod bral zung 'jug dngos/ / ngo bo nyid sku khyed la 'dud/ /
The manifestations of the body of form are of all kinds, Yet their nature is unchanging. It is the true state of union, wondrous and inexpressible: Body of the essential nature, to you I bow.
rnam shes tshogs brgyad gnas gyur zhing*/ / nyon mongs sgrib pa kun spangs pas/ / phung po lnga las yongs grol ba'i/ / ye shes lnga bdag khyed la 'dud/ /
By transforming the eight consciousnesses And eliminating all defilements and obscurations You are completely freed from the five aggregates. Lords of the five kinds of gnosis, to you I bow.
so so rigs bzhi'i thugs mnga' bas/ / stobs bcu'i bdud kyi dpung bcom nas/ / mi 'jig bzhi yis chos ston pa/ / yon tan mnga' bdag khyed la 'dud/ /

You whose minds possess the four perfect knowledges Have conquered the armies of demons with the ten strengths And teach the dharma by means of the four fearlessnesses. Possessors of all good qualities, to you I bow.
spyod pa rtogs pa ye shes dang*/ / phrin las gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'i/ / sangs rgyas yon tan bco brgyad can/ / mtshungs med dam pa khyed la 'dud/ /
In your conduct, realization, gnosis, and activities You possess the eighteen qualities of a buddha That are not shared with others. Peerless holy beings, to you I bow.
rdo rje 'chang chen lU yi lI la pa/ / mthu stobs dbang phyug dom+bi sha ba ri/ / sa ra ha pa kang+ka li pa dang*/ / mI na go rak+Sha la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
To the great Vajradhara, Lūyipa, Līlapa, Virūpa, Ḍombipa, Shavaripa, Saraha, Kangkālipāda, Mīnapa, and Gorakṣha I pay homage.
tsau ring+ga dang wI Na shAn+ti pa/ / tsan+ti tsa ma ri dang khaD+ga pa/ / klu sgrub spyod 'chang dbang po 'phags pa lha/ / tha ga nA ro pa la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
To Chauraṅgi, Vīnapa, and Ratnakarashānti,[7] Tantipa,[8] Chamaripa, and Khaḍgapa, Nāgārjuna, Kṛiṣhṇāchāri,[9] and Āryadeva, Thaganapa, and Nāropa I pay homage.
sh+ya li te tsa tra b+ha dra pa/ / d+hU khan+d+hi dang sbyor bral ga la pa/ / d+hU ti kang+ka na dang kam+ba la/ / Ding+gi ban+d+he pa phyag 'tshal lo/ /
To Shyalipa,[10] Tilopa, Chatrapa, and Bhadrapa, Dhukhandi, Āyogipāda, and Kalapa, Dhombipa,[11] Kaṅkana, and Kambala, Ḍiṅgipa,[12] and Bhandhepa I pay homage.
tan+te ku ku ri dang ku dzi pa/ / d+ha ma ma hi la dang a tsin+ta/ / ba b+ha nA li na ba zhi ba lha/ / in+d+ra bo d+hi rnams la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
To Tandhepa, Kukkuripa, and Kujipa,[13] Dhamapa, Mahila,[14] Achinta, Babhahi, Nalina, Shāntideva,[15] And Indrabhūti I pay homage.
me ko tog rtse pa dang kam+b+ha ri/ / dza lan+d+har rA hu d+harma pa/ / d+ho ka me d+hi pa na sang+ka dza/ / rdo rje dril bu pa la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
To Mekopa, Togchepa,[16] Kamparipa, Jālandhara,[17] Rāhula, Dharmapa, Dhokaripa, Medhina, Saṅkaja,[18] And Ghaṇḍhapa I pay homage.
dzo ki tsa li ki pa ko ru ra/ / lu tsi dza ya nan+ti na gu Na/ / ba tsa ri dang tsa mA ka b+hi k+Sha/ / d+hi le kum+b+ha ri la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
To Yogipa, Chaliki,[19] Gorura, Luchika, Jayānanti, Naguṇa,[20] Pachari, Champaka, Bhikṣhana, Dhilipa,[21] and Kumbharipa I pay homage.
tsar+pa Ti pa ma Ni b+ha dra dang*/ / mi khA li ma ka na kha ma la/ / ka la ka la pa dang skan+d+ha li/ / d+ha hu u d+hi li la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
To Charpaṭipa,[22] Maṇibhadrā, Mekhali, Kanakhalā, Kalakala, Kandhalipa, Dhahulipa, and Udhilipa[23] I pay homage.
ka pA la pa ka ra ba la dzar/ / sa ka ra pa sarba b+hak+Shapa/ / na ga bo d+hi dA ra'i ka pa che/ / su ta li pa rnams la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
To Kapālapa, Kiravalapa,[24] Sakarapa, Sarvabhakṣhapa, Nāgabodhi, the great Dārikapa, And Putalipa[25] I pay homage. {110}
pa ha na pa ko ki la pa dang*/ / a nod+ga pa lak+Sh+mI ka ra/ / sa mu dra pa byA li pad bcas/ / grub chen brgyad bcu rtsa bzhir phyag 'tshal lo/ /
To Pahanapa,[26] Kokilapa,[27] Anonga,[28] Lakṣhmīnkarā, Samudrapa, and Vyālipa— To all these eighty-four great siddhas I pay homage.
lhag pa'i lha dang grub pas rjes su bzung*/ / dam pa'i rigs sad chos nyid bden pa gzigs/ / mi slob lam la zung 'jug sku mchog brnyes/ / rnal 'byor dbang phyug rnams la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

Guided by the supreme deities and siddhas, You awakened the supreme potential and beheld the truth of ultimate reality. On the path beyond training you attained the sublime body of union. To the lords of yogis I pay homage.
rtsa brgyud bla ma yi dam lha yi tshogs/ / sangs rgyas byang sems mkha' 'gro chos skyong la/ / ma lus zhing rdul grangs snyed rab sprul nas/ / sgo gsum gus pa chen pos phyag 'tshal lo/ /

To the root and lineage teachers, hosts of yidam deities, Buddhas, bodhisattvas, ḍākinīs, and dharma protectors, Manifesting forms as numerous as the atoms in the entire universe, With great respect of body, speech, and mind I pay homage.
de nas mchod pa phul ba la thog mar chu gnyis dang nyer spyod lnga ni/
To make the offerings, begin with the two water offerings and five sense offerings.
dri med rnam dag yi 'ong lha yi rdzas/ / yan lag brgyad ldan rdo rje ar+g+haM'i rgyun/ / mchod tu dad pa'i yid kyis bdag 'bul na/ / ci bde bar ni dgyes par bzhes su gsol/ /

Untainted, pure, and pleasing substance of the gods, The ornament of vajra drinking water, endowed with eight qualities— As I offer it with the utmost faith in mind, I pray, accept it joyfully, as you please.
oM AHhri pra wa ra sa rka raM ar+g+haM pra tIts+tsha swA hA/
oṁ āḥ hri pravara sarkaraṃ arghaṃ pratīccha svāhā
dri med rnam dag yid 'ong lha yi rdzas/ / zhabs kyi pad+mo'i rnyogs sel spos kyi chu/ / mchog tu dad pa'i yid kyis bdag 'bul na/ / ci bde bar ni dgyes par bzhes su gsol/ /

Untainted, pure, and pleasing substances of the gods, Scented waters that remove the dirt from your lotus feet, As I offer them with the utmost faith in mind, I pray, accept them joyfully, as you please.
sngags gong ltar la/ ar+g+haM mal du/ pA d+yaM sbyar/
oṁ āḥ hri pravara sarkaraṃ pādyaṃ pratīccha svāhā
mdog bzang dbyibs legs tshim pa'i dri bsung can/ / man+da ra dang ut+pal ku muta sogs/ / dngos 'byor yid kyis sprul pa'i me tog kun/ / bla ma grub thob dkyil 'khor tshogs la 'bu/ /

All kinds of flowers, real and imagined by the mind, Māndāravas, utpalas, kumuda lilies, and the like, Of lovely colors, perfect shape, and sweet and satisfying scent— These I offer to the teacher, the siddhas, and assembly of the mandala.
oM gu ru badz+ra d+ha ra sarba yo ga shwa ra de ba Da ki nI sa pa ri wA ra badz+ra puSh+pe pra tIts+tsha swA hA/
oṁ guru vajradhara sarva yogeśvara deva ḍākinī saparivāra vajra puṣpe praticcha svāhā
rgyu bzang mnam na zhim pa'i dri ngad can/ / a ka ru dang tsan+dan sbrul snying sogs/ / dngos 'byor yid kyis sprul pa'i bdug spos kun/ / bla ma grub thob=

All kinds of incense, real and imagined by the mind, Aloe, snakeheart sandalwood, and the like, Of good ingredients, and the sweetest smell— These I offer to the teacher, the siddhas, and assembly of the mandala.
badz+ra d+hU pe=
oṁ guru vajradhara sarva yogeśvara deva ḍākinī saparivāra vajra dhūpe praticcha svāhā
mun sel dngos grub gsal ba'i gzi brjid can/ / sgron me nyi zla lus kyi 'od la sogs/ / dngos 'byor yid kyis sprul pa'i snang gsal kun/ / bla ma grub thob=

All kinds of lights, real and imagined by the mind, Lamps, the sun and moon, physical radiance, and the like, Dispelling darkness, radiant with the light of accomplishment— These I offer to the teacher, the siddhas, and assembly of the mandala.
badz+ra A lo ke=
oṁ guru vajradhara sarva yogeśvara deva ḍākinī saparivāra vajra āloke praticcha svāhā {111}
dri zhim byugs na bde ba'i rig mchog kun/ / ga bur gla rtsi mnam pa'i dri la sogs/ / dngos 'byor yid kyis sprul pa'i dri mchog kun/ / bla ma grub thob=

All kinds of perfumes, real and imagined by the mind, Camphor, musk, and other ingredients sweet to smell, All the finest fragrances, unguents blissful to the touch— These I offer to the teacher, the siddhas, and assembly of the mandala.
badz+ra gan+d+he=
oṁ guru vajradhara sarva yogeśvara deva ḍākinī saparivāra vajra gandhe praticcha svāhā
mdog bzang myong na bde ba'i ro bcud ldan/ / 'bras chen ka ra rgya bstar khu ba sogs/ / dngos 'byor yid kyis sprul pa'i zhal zas kun/ / bla ma grub thob=

All kinds of delicacies, real and imagined by the mind, Scented rice and sugar, berry juice, and other treats, Beautifully colored, blissfully flavored, and nutritious— These I offer to the teacher, the siddhas, and assembly of the mandala.
badz+ra ni wi t+ya=
oṁ guru vajradhara sarva yogeśvara deva ḍākinī saparivāra vajra naividye praticcha svāhā
don zab thos na snyan pa'i sgra dbyangs can/ / rnga chen dung dang pheg rdob rgud mang sogs/ / dngosa'agyor yid kyis sprul pa'i sil snyan kun/ / bla ma grub thob=

All kinds of musical instruments, real and imagined by the mind, Drums and conches, cymbals, lutes, and the like, Profoundly inspiring and pleasantly melodious— These I offer to the teacher, the siddhas, and assembly of the mandala.
badz+ra shap+da zhes sbyar/
oṁ guru vajradhara sarva yogeśvara deva ḍākinī saparivāra vajra śabda praticcha svāhā
de nas mchod pa'i maN+Dal phyi zhing lag len tshul ldan byas la tshom bu so bdun ma sogs rgyas bsdus tshar grangs gang lcogs dang*/

Next, to make the offering of the mandala, as if holding the outer universe in your hands, perform a detailed offering such as the mandala with thirty-seven piles, or a condensed one, as many times as you can. And:

ri mchog gser gyi ri dang rol mtsho brgya ldan 'khor yug bcas/ / gling rnams lha dang mi yi 'byor pa kun gyis rnam par brgyan/ / gzugs mdzes yan lag mchog ldan zag med bde ster lha mos spras/ / sangs rgyas kun gyi rnam dag zhing du yongs su bsngo bar bgyi/ /

The supreme mountain, the golden mountain ranges, hundred seas of enjoyment, and outer mountain ring, And the continents, all adorned with all the riches of gods and humankind, And embellished with goddesses bestowing untainted bliss, of beautiful form and perfect limbs, I dedicate as the perfect buddha field of all the buddhas.
rab yangs 'byung bzhi'i dkyil 'khor brtan pa la/ / bkod legs ri gling 'khor yug rgya mtshos spras/ / brtan g.yo'i dpal gyis phyur bur gtams pa yi/ / phun tshogs 'jig rten khams kyis bla ma mchod/ /

The utterly vast and solid mandala of the four elements, Adorned in perfect layout by Mount Meru, the continents, mountain ring, and oceans, Completely filled with the glory of all worlds and beings— With this perfect and abundant offering of the universe, I venerate the teachers.
snod kyi 'jig rten sa phyogs yid 'ong na/ / bcud kyi sems can mchod pa gang gnas/ / bdag pos bzung dang ma bzung de dag kun/ / blo yis blangs nas bla ma'i dkyil 'khor mchod/ /
This beautiful place that is the universe, And all the beings and offerings contained therein— All that is owned or has no owner I mentally take and offer to the mandala of the teachers.
sngags snga ma ltar la/ rat+na maN+Dal pU dza me g+ha sa mu dra s+pha ra Na sa ma ye hU~M/
Use the same mantra as before, with ratna manḍala pūja megha samudra sapharaṇa samaye hūṁ.
dri med bai DU'i sa gzhi yangs pa la/ / gser dngul rtsig pa ba gam drwa ba can/ / rin chen ka bas bteg cing khyon yangs pa/ / yid 'ong pho brang gzhal med dam pas mchod/ /
On the vast and spotless beryl ground, With walls of gold and silver, domes and latticework, Held up by jeweled pillars, and of vast dimensions, The supreme and lovely measureless palace I offer.
bla bre rgyal mtshan gdugs so steng nas mdzes/ / dar dbyangs lhab lhub yol bas logs nas brgyan/ / khri dang gdan sogs 'og nas brjid gyur pa'i/ / phun tshogs nyer mkho'i gzigs chu kun gyis mchod/ /

Adorned on top with canopies, victory banners, parasols, and the like, Its sides decorated with curtains of gently waving silks, {112} Its floors magnificently laid out with thrones and cushions, All these perfect palatial furnishings I offer.
thar pa'i rgyal mtshan chos gos ngur smrig dang*/ / srab 'jam yang ba'i pany+tsa li ka dang*/ / rgyu bzang dri zhim kA shi'i ras la sogs/ / phun tshogs na bza' kun gyis bla ma mchod/ /

Saffron dharma robes—the victory banner of liberation— Rainbow-colored cloth that is fine and light and soft, Sweetly scented Benares cloth of finest stuff, And every other kind of excellent raiment I offer to the teachers.
rigs lnga'i dbu rgyan dar gyi cod pan dang*/ / mu tig do shal nor bu'i ga sha dang*/ / rin chen phra bkod gser gyi gdu bu sogs/ / phun tshogs rgyan mchod kun gyis=

The crown of the five families, the silken headdress, Long necklaces of pearls, strings of jewel beads, Golden bracelets set with precious jewels, And every other kind of splendid ornament I offer to the teachers.
bsod nams du ma'i dpal las grub pa'i rdzas/ / 'khor lo nor bu btsun mo blon po dang*/ / glang po rta mchog dmag mi rin chen te/ / rgyal srid rin chen kun gyis=

Items fashioned from the wealth of abundant merit— The precious wheel, jewel, queen, and minister, Elephant, supreme horse, and general— All these precious attributes of royalty I offer to the teachers.
nye bar mkho ba'i 'dod rgu 'byung ba'i rdzas/ / nags tshal ral gri khang bzang mal stan dang*/ / lha yi gos dang sprul gyi pags pa lham/ / nye ba'i sna bdun gyis=
Articles that fulfill one’s daily needs— Woodlands, swords, mansions, bedclothes, Divine garments, snakeskin, and shoes— All these seven semiprecious articles I offer to the teachers.
skye dgu bde zhing dge bar byed pa'i rdzas/ / rtsa mchog dUrba bi wa gi waM zho/ / me long li khri yungs kar g.yas 'khyil dung*/ / bkra shis rdzas mchod brgyad kyis=

Things creating happiness and virtue for all beings— Durva grass, vilva fruit, bezoar, and curds, Mirrors, vermilion, white mustard, and conches spiraling right— These eight auspicious objects I offer to the teachers.
bsod nams brgyad ldan mtshan bzang las grub pa'i/ / dpal be'u 'khor lo pad+ma rgyal mtshan dang*/ / gdugs dang bum bzang dung dkar gser nya ste/ / bkra shis rtags brgyad kun gyis=

Created from the major marks of those with the eight kinds of merit[29]— The eternal knot, wheel, lotus, victory banner, Parasol, excellent vase, white conch, and golden fish— These eight auspicious symbols I offer to the teachers.
'dod 'jo'i ba mo dpag bsam ljon pa'i shing*/ / ma rmos lo tog yid bzhin nor bu dang*/ / 'chi med bdud rtsi ro brgya'i zas la sogs/ / longs spyod phun tshogs kun gyis bla ma mchod/ /

The bountiful cow, the wish-fulfilling tree, The spontaneous harvest, and the wish-fulfilling gem, The nectar of immortality, nutritious, tasty foods, and the like— All perfect and abundant things to be enjoyed I offer to the teachers.
dkon mchog mchod dang sems can don bsgrub phyir/ / bsod nams longs spyod bcas pa bdag gi lus/ / skyes mchod khyed kyi bran du legs phul nas/ / ji ltar bgo ba'i don kun bsgrub bgyi'o/ /
In order to venerate the Three Jewels and benefit beings, My merit, possessions, and bodies I offer entirely for the service of you, sublime beings, And I will do whatever you command.
nang mchod 'dod yon lnga ni/
The inner offering, the five offerings pleasing to the senses:
rab 'byams phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten ji snyed na/ / kha dog dbyibs kyi gzugs mchod 'os kun/ / rab mdzes gzugs kyi lha mor blos sprul nas/ / mgon po sgrib med rdo rje'i spyan la 'bul/ /

In all the worlds in the immensity of the ten directions, All sublime forms worth offering, the finest in color and shape, {113} I mentally manifest as goddesses of exquisite form And offer to the refuge lords’ unobscured vajra eyes.
sngags gong ltar la/ rU pa kA ma gu Na pU dza AHhUM/
Use the same mantra as before, with rūpa kāma guṇa pūja āḥ hūṁ.
rab 'byams= zin dang ma zin sgra mchod 'os kun/ / rab mdzes sgra yi lha mor blos sprul nas/ / mgon po sgrib med rdo rje'i snyan la 'bul/ /

In all the worlds in the immensity of the ten directions, All sublime sounds worth offering, of animate and inanimate origin, I mentally manifest as goddesses of exquisite sound And offer to the refuge lords’ unobscured vajra ears.
shap+da kA ma=
…śabda kāma guṇa pūja āḥ hūṁ.
rab 'byams= lhan skyes sbyar ba'i dri mchog ji snyed kun/ / rab mdzes dri yi lha bor= mgon po sgrib med rdo rje'i shangs la 'bul/ /

In all the worlds in the immensity of the ten directions, All sublime fragrances worth offering, natural and prepared, I mentally manifest as goddesses of exquisite smell And offer to the refuge lords’ unobscured vajra noses.
gan+d+he=
…gandhe kāma guṇa pūja āḥ hūṁ.
rab 'byams= bza' bca' btung ba'i mchog mchod 'os kun/ / rab mdzes ro yi lha mor= mgon po sgrib med rdo rje'i ljags la 'bul/ /

In all the worlds in the immensity of the ten directions, All sublime flavors worth offering, delicious food and drink, I mentally manifest as goddesses of exquisite taste And offer to the refuge lords’ unobscured vajra tongues.
ra sa kA ma=
…rasa kāma guṇa pūja āḥ hūṁ.
rab 'byams= sems can sems can min pa'i rig mchog kun/ / rab mdzes reg bya'i lha mor= mgon po sgrib med rdo rje'i sku la 'bul/ /

In all the worlds in the immensity of the ten directions, All sublime sensations worth offering, produced by beings and not so produced, I mentally manifest as goddesses of exquisite touch And offer to the refuge lords’ unobscured vajra bodies.
spar+she kA ma= oM AHhU~M/
…sparṣe kāma guṇa pūja āḥ hūṁ. oṁ āḥ hūṁ

bdud rtsi lnga yi bza' ba ni/ / dngos grub kun gyi de nyid mchog / sgron ma lnga yi bza' ba ni/ / sangs rgyas kun gyi dam tshig gtso/ / nyes bral zhi ba'i btung ba mchog / sbrang rtsi bu ram 'bru dang shing*/ / bcos pa'i myos byed rnam pa lnga/ / shes rab rang bzhin dbul bar bgyi/ /

The food of the five nectars— The supreme nature of all accomplishments; The food of the five meats— The principal samaya of all the buddhas; The sublime and flawless drink of peace— The five intoxicating liquors (mead, sugarcane beer, Grain beer, fruit wine, and processed alcohol)— All these, which have the nature of wisdom, I offer.
sngags gong ltar la/ pany+tsa a mr-i ta=
Use the same mantra as before, with pañca amṛta…
gsang mchod rig ma bcu drug ni/
The secret offering, the offering of the sixteen offering goddesses:

bde mchog sgyu ma'i longs spyod rdzogs gsal ba/ / pi waM gling bu rnga zlum rdza rnga can/ / rgod dang sgeg dang glu len bro gar mkhan/ / me tog bdug pa sna gsal dri mchog ma/ / gzugs ma ro ma reg ma chos 'byung ma/ / bcu drug dga' ba'i cha shas yongs rdzogs ma/ / rdo rje rig ma gda' ba'i rol pa 'dis/ / he ru ka khyed rdo rje'i yid dges mdzod/ /
rdo rje pad+mar byin brlabs nas/ / snyoms 'jug 'pho med bde chen thob/ / rang bzhin snang ba yongs dag pa/ / zhu bdes khams gsum kun khyab pa/ / gsang ba'i mchod pas mnyes par bgyi/ /

Through the blessings of the vajras in the lotuses, The great unchanging bliss of union is achieved. The melting bliss, by nature pure appearance, Fills the whole of the three worlds, Delighting you with the secret offering.
sngags mthar/ a nu rak+to ma hA su kha=
At the end of the mantra, add anurakto mahāsukha…
de kho nyid kyi mchod pa ni/
The offering of thatness: {114}

'gro ba chu yi zla ba bzhin du lta ba dang*/ / thos pa brag cha dang ni mtshungs par yang dag 'jug / sems kyang mya ngam smrig rgyu lta bur blta bya zhing*/ / 'di ltar bza' dang btung bdag ni nam mkha' lta bu ste/ / dri ni nam mkha' me tog mtshungs par mnam pa dang*/ / yid ni nyi ma zla ba lta bur khyab pa nyid/ / yang dag gnas pa de yang ri bo mchog tu mtshungs pa yin/ / gzhon nu ma yi rmi lam ji bzhin rmi bar bya/ / tha snyad dag ni sgyu ma mig 'phrul lta bur brjod/ / 'dir ltar ji bzhin lhan skyes bde 'byung de bzhin te/ / srid pa'i rang bzhin bral ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa yi thugs/ / rtag tu 'char ba bde gshegs lam mchog dag gis mchod/ /

Beings are viewed as like the moon’s reflection in water. Sounds are heard authentically, resembling echoes. The mind is seen as like a mirage in the desert. Thus the nature of food and drink is like space; Fragrances are smelled as if they were flowers in the sky. The mind pervades everything like the sun and moon. This authentic mode of being is like the supreme mountain. It is how a young girl’s dream is dreamed. Conventional designations are uttered like magical illusions or visual tricks. Thus does coemergent bliss arise, And likewise the mind—inconceivable, free of the nature of existence— Arises constantly. These, the sublime ways of the sugatas, I offer.
de nas bstod pa rgya bod bla ma rnams kyis mdzad pa khungs ldan ji rigs pa dang*/ spyi bstod ni/
Next, recite any suitable authentic praises composed by the teachers of India and Tibet, and, as a general praise:
rnam dag sku ni skyon bral 'khrul pa med/ / phun tshogs gsung dbyangs shes bya ma lus khyab/ / zab dang rgya che'i de nyid mkhyen pa'i thugs/ / rdo rje gsum dngos bla ma'i tshogs la bstod/ /

Your pure bodies are free of defects and dysfunction. Your perfect melodious speech embraces every topic of knowledge. Your minds know the truth of the profound and extensive teachings: Hosts of teachers, embodiments of the three vajras, to you I give praise.
nyes pa'i skyon kun rab spangs shing*/ / legs pa'i yon tan kun ldan pas/ / phan bde dpal 'byor kun 'byung ba'i/ / dpal ldan bla ma khyed la bstod/ /
Wholly rid of every kind of fault, Possessed of every excellent quality, Sources of all benefit and happiness, glory and prosperity— Glorious teachers, to you I give praise.
gdul bya smin cing grol ba'i phyir/ / dus gsum sangs rgyas thams cad nyid/ / 'dren pa'i tshul du rnam 'phrul pa'i/ dpal ldan bla ma khyed la bstod/
In order to mature and liberate beings, You manifest in the form of guides, Embodiments of all the buddhas of the three times. Glorious teachers, to you I give praise.
khyed sku sha dang rus bral yang*/ / ye shes gzugs su snang ba'i sku/ / dad pa'i mig rkyen mchog gyur ba/ / sku yid dbang phyug khyed la bstod/ /
Your bodies transcend flesh and bone, Bodies that are wisdom manifesting as form. Seen with the eye of faith, they are sublime. Lords of enlightened body, to you I give praise.
brjod 'dod rtsol ba mi mnga' yang*/ / yan lag drug cu'i gsung dbyangs kyis/ / zab dang rgya che'i don ston pa/ / gsung gi dbang phyug khyed la bstod/ /
Spontaneously and effortlessly, With the sixty expressive qualities of speech You teach all subjects, profound and vast. Lords of enlightened speech, to you I give praise.
shes dang shes bya'i spros bral yang*/ / shes bya'i dkyil 'khor gsal ba'i thugs/ / snying rje'i gzugs spobs du ma'i gter/ / thugs rje'i dbang phyug khyed la bstod*/ /

Although free of the elaborations of knowing and something to be known, Your minds illuminate the mandala of knowledge. Manifold treasures of the compassionate powers of retention and eloquence, Lords of enlightened mind, to you I give praise.
yon tan cha tsam 'gro kun gyis/ / bskal par brjod kyang mi zad pa'i/ / spyan dang mngon shes rdzu 'phrul sogs/ / yon tan dbang phyug khyed la bstod/ /

Were all beings to relate just a few of your qualities {115} For kalpas long, they would never be finished, So endless are your vision, clairvoyance, miraculous powers, and the rest. Lords of enlightened qualities, to you I give praise.
mthong thos dran pas don ldan na/ / bsten na phrog pa ci smos pa/ / lhun grub rgyun chad mi mnga' ba'i/ / phrin las dbang phyug khyed la bstod/ /

If seeing you, hearing you, thinking of you brings benefit, No need to mention being freed[30] by following you. You act spontaneously, unceasingly. Lords of enlightened activity, to you I give praise.
bde dang stong pa dbyer med pas/ / thabs shes zung du 'jug pa'i dngos/ / sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje can/ / 'gro ba'i dpal mgon khyed la bstod/ /
Bliss and emptiness being inseparable, You personify the union of means and wisdom. You who possess the adamantine body, speech, and mind, Glorious protectors of beings, to you I give praise.
khyed sku phung po'i rigs lnga ste/ / 'byung ba yum lnga'i lha mo dang*/ / zung 'jug lhan skyes rdo rje'i sku/ / 'gro ba'i dpal mgon khyed la bstod/ /
The aggregates of your bodies are the five male buddhas, The elements are the five female buddhas, And their union is the coemergent vajra body. Glorious protectors of beings, to you I give praise.
dbang po rnams ni sems dpa' ste/ / yul drug sems ma'i tshogs rnams dang*/ / zung 'jug lhan skyes rdo rje'i sku/ / 'gro ba'i dpal mgon=
Your sense organs are the male bodhisattvas, Their six objects are the female bodhisattvas, And their union is the coemergent vajra body. Glorious protectors of beings, to you I give praise.
yan lag rnams ni khro rgyal te/ / bya ba rnam bcu'i khro mo dang*/ zung 'jug= 'gro ba'i =
Your limbs are the wrathful kings, Your ten activities are the wrathful queens, And their union is the coemergent vajra body. Glorious protectors of beings, to you I give praise.
khyed sku'i khams rnams dpa' bo ste/ / rtsa gnas dpa' mo'i tshogs rnams dang*/ / zung 'jug = 'gro ba'i =
The constituents of your body are ḍākas, The stationary channels are the hosts of ḍākinīs, And their union is the coemergent vajra body. Glorious protectors of beings, to you I give praise.
rtsa ba'i rlung rnams yab lnga ste/ / 'byung ba lnga yi yum rnams dang*/ / zung 'jug lhan skyes rdo rje'i gsung*/ / 'gro ba'i dpal =
The major winds are the five fathers, The five elements are the mothers, And their union is the coemergent vajra speech. Glorious protectors of beings, to you I give praise.
khyod thugs ye shes rang bzhin ste/ / snang yul chos kyi dbyings rnams dang*/ / zung 'jug lhan skyes rdo rje'i thugs/ / 'gro ba'i dpal mgon khyed la bstod/ /
Your mind is the nature of primordial wisdom, The objects that appear are the expanse of reality, And their union is the coemergent vajra mind. Glorious protectors of beings, to you I give praise.
dkyus su de tsam gyis 'thus/ / cung zad spro na/
This praise on its own is sufficient, but if you wish to do a slightly more detailed praise, you may also recite the following:
chos kun dbyings su mngon byang chub/ / bde stong zung 'jug srid zhi'i dpal/ / rigs brgya'i khyab bdag 'khor lo'i mgon/ / rdo rje 'chang la phyag 'tshal bstod/ /

Enlightened state of all phenomena in the expanse of reality, Union of bliss and emptiness, glory of existence and peace, All-pervading lord of the hundred families, lord of the mandala, To Vajradhara, homage and praise!
rgyal srid spangs nas gang+gA'i 'gram/ / nya yi rgyu ltos 'tsho ba mdzad*/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes lU yi pa/ / rnal 'byor dbang phyug zhabs la 'dud/ /
Abandoning your kingdom, on the banks of the Ganges You lived by eating fish guts. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Lūyipa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
rgyal rigs 'dod yon lnga yis sgeg / dran pa gcig pa'i ting 'dzin gyis/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes lI la pa/ / rnal 'byor dbang phyug zhabs la 'dud/ /
Charmed by the five pleasures of royal life, Through concentration with one-pointed mindfulness You attained supreme accomplishment. Līlapa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow. {116}
phag mo bsgrubs pas dngos byin rlabs/ / ngo mtshar rdzu 'phrul du ma bstan/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes bi rU pa/ / rnal 'byor=
By practicing Vajravarāhī, you were blessed by her in person And displayed many wondrous miraculous powers. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Virūpa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
dgyes pa rdo rje dngos su grub/ / stag la chibs nas spyod pa spyad/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes Dom+bi pa/ / rnal 'byor=
Accomplishing Hevajra, You rode a tiger and engaged in yogic conduct. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Ḍombipa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
spyan ras gzigs kyis rjes su bzung*/ / ye shes sku yis 'gro don mdzad/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes sha ba ri/ / rnal 'byor=
Guided by Avalokiteshvara, In the wisdom body you benefited beings. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Shavaripa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
bram ze'i rigs las gnyis rtog chod/ / phyag rgya chen po mthar thug rtogs/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes sa ra ha/ / rnal 'byor=
Born in a brahmin family, you cut through dualistic thought And realized the ultimate Great Seal. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Saraha, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
tha mal chung ma'i rnam rtog nyid/ / bde stong 'od gsal dbyings su stor/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes kaM ka ri/ / rnal 'byor=
The thought of your ordinary wife You dissolved into the radiant expanse of bliss and emptiness. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Kaṅkālapāda, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
nya ltong 'jig rten mchog thob cing*/ / rim par sa lam yon tan rdzogs/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes mI na pa/ / rnal 'byor=

In the belly of a fish you gained the highest mundane level And successively completed the qualities of the levels and paths. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Mīnapa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
la nga skyong bzhin gdams pas grol/ / sems can sa ya gtan bder bkod/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes go rak+Sha/ / rnal 'byor=

While living as a cowherd, you were liberated by the instructions, And you set a million beings in lasting happiness. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Gorakṣha, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
bsam su med pa'i gdams ngag gis/ / yan lag bcad pa rang sor chud/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes tsau ring+ga/ / rnal 'byor=
Through the instructions on no-thought Your amputated limbs grew back on their own. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Chauraṅgi, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
pi waM sgra las ting 'dzin grub/ / g+ha hu'i grong khyer chos la bkod/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes wI Na pa/ / rnal 'byor=
From the sound of the vina you practiced concentration And established in dharma the cities of Ghahuri. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Vīnapa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
mkhas shing grub pas thub bstan skyong*/ / slob ma'i gdams pas bden pa gzigs/sasas / dngos grub mchog brnyes shAn+ti pa/ / rnal 'byor=

With your learning and accomplishment you preserved the Buddha’s doctrine, And with your student’s instructions you saw the truth. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Shāntipa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
thag mkhan rgan po gzhon nu'i lus/ / san+do'i grong khyer mkha' spyod bkod/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes tan+te pa/ / rnal 'byor=
An old weaver in the body of a youth, You brought the citizens of Sandhonāgara to the celestial lands. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Tantipa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
lham bzos sems sbyong phrug gcig gis/ / dri ma kun dag gnas lugs rtogs/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes tsa ma ri/ / rnal 'byor=

As a shoemaker you trained your mind, and on a single seat You purified all stains and realized the true condition of things. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Chamaripa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
thun mong ral gri'i grub pa thob/ / sgo gsum 'khrul pa'i dri ma sangs/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes khaD+ga ba/ / rnal 'byor=
Attaining the common siddhi of the sword, You cleansed your three doors of the stains of delusion. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Khaḍgapa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
sangs rgyas gnyis pa'i mdzad pa skyong*/ / shing rta chen po'i lam srol gtod/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes 'phags pa klu/ / rnal 'byor=
Observing the deeds of a second Buddha, {117} You founded the tradition of the Great Charioteer. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Noble Nāgārjuna, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
sum stong 'khor bcas brtul zhugs spyod/ / bar dor mngon par byang chub pa'i/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes kah+Na pa/ / rnal 'byor=

With three thousand disciples you practiced yogic discipline And attained true enlightenment in the intermediate state. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Kāṇḥapa,[31] lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
mngal gyis ma gos brdzus te 'khrungs/ / nyon mongs dgra bcom chos nyid mthong*/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes 'phags pa lha/ / rnal 'byor=
Born miraculously, unstained by a womb, You conquered the enemy of defilement and saw ultimate reality. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Āryadeva, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
brdzun smra'i gnyen por brdzun bsgoms pas/ / snang srid brdzun gyis chos su rtogs/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes tha ga pa/ / rnal 'byor=
As an antidote to lying, you meditated on lies And thus realized phenomenal existence to be itself a lie. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Thaganapa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
gnas lnga mthar phyin paN+Di ta/ / dka' ba chen po bcu gnyis spyad/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes na ro pa/ / rnal 'byor=
A paṇḍita perfectly learned in the five sciences, You underwent twelve major ordeals. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Nāropa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
sgra kun spyang ki'i skad du nub/ / 'jigs med rang grol nyams rtogs shar/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes sh+ya li pa/ / rnal 'byor=

All sounds subsided into the howl of the wolf And were liberated by themselves in fearlessness: experiences and realization arose. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Shyalipa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
bka' bzhi brgyud pas byin gyis brlabs/ / rdo rje 'chang gis rjes su bzung*/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes til+li pa/ / rnal 'byor=
Blessed by the lineage of the four precepts, You were taken as a disciple by Vajradhara. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Tilopa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
stong nyid snying rje'i rnal 'byor bsgoms/ / lnga brgya'i 'khor bcas mkha' spyod gshegs/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes tsa tra pa/ / rnal 'byor=
Meditating on uniting emptiness and compassion, You departed to a celestial land with five hundred followers. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Chatrapa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
lta sgom spyod pa'i brda' don rtogs/ / snang srid 'khrul pa'i gzugs brnyan mthong*/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes b+ha dra pa/ / rnal 'byor=

Understanding the meaning of the symbols of view, meditation, and conduct, You saw that phenomenal existence is a delusory facade. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Bhadrapa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
phyag dar khrod kyi tshem drub dang*/ / lha sngags dbyer med chos skur rtogs/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes d+hU khan+d+hi/ / rnal 'byor=

You patched together rags from rubbish heaps And realized the inseparability of deity and mantra as the body of truth. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Dhukhandi, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
stong sgo'i sna rtser gsal snang thob/ / mtshan 'dzin chos nyid ngang du stor/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes a dzo gi / rnal 'byor=

Achieving clear visualization of the thousand worlds on the tip of your nose, your upper door, You dissolved conceptual beliefs into the state of ultimate reality. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Āyogipāda, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
gzugs mdzes bskyed rdzogs don la sbyangs/ / shugs 'byung lhug pa'i spyod pa spyad/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes ka la ba/ / rnal 'byor=
Of handsome body, you trained in the generation and perfection phases And engaged in spontaneous, free conduct. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Kalapa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
chu dang ting 'dzin lhan cig pa'i/ / khrus kyis sgrib gnyis rtsad nas dag / dngos grub mchog brnyes d+hu pi pa/ / rnal 'byor=
By washing with water and concentration together, You completely purified the two obscurations. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Dhombipa,[32] lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
phyag gdub sems zin lnga brgya'i lor/ / blon 'bangs 'khor bcas mkha' spyod grub/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes kang+ka na/ / rnal 'byor=

Having concentrated on your bracelet, after five hundred years {118} You attained the celestial land with your ministers and people. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Kaṅkana, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
yum gyi gdams pas rang rgyud grol/ / phra man mang btul l+wa ba gsol/ / dngos grub mchog nyes kam+ba la/ / rnal 'byor=
Through the instructions of your mother your mind was liberated. You subdued many witches and wore a woolen cloak. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Kambala, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
'bras rdungs las kyi rtog pa sbyangs/ / bdun brgya'i 'khor bcas mkha' spyod grub/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes Ding+gi pa/ / rnal 'byor=
By threshing rice, you purified the concept of karma And attained the celestial land with seven hundred followers. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Ḍiṅgipa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
tshad med bzhi yi lta sgom spyad/ / bzhi brgya'i 'khor bcas mkha' spyod gshegs/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes ban+d+he pa/ / rnal 'byor=

Practicing the view, meditation, and conduct of the four boundless attitudes, You departed to a celestial land with four hundred followers. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Bhandhepa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
cho los nor rdzas zad pa'i dpes/ / khams gsum rnam rtog dbyings su zad/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes tan+te pa/ / rnal 'byor=

You used the analogy of losing all your wealth gambling, And the concepts of the three worlds were consumed in the expanse of reality.[33] You who attained supreme accomplishment, Tandhepa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
mngon shes ldan cing lha yis mchod/ / DA ki khye gu'i gzugs can bsten/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes ku ku ri/ / rnal 'byor=
