Possessed of preternatural powers and venerated by the gods, You followed a ḍākinī who had taken the form of a puppy. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Kukkuripa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
lba ba yod med rtog pa yi/ / mtha' gnyis spangs pas mtha' bral rtogs/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes ma hi pa/ / rnal 'byor=

By eliminating the two conceptual extremes Of your tumor existing and not existing, you realized the state beyond extremes. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Kujipa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
thos pa 'dzin la rab brtson nas/ / du ma ro gcig rtogs pa skyes/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes d+ha ma pa/ / rnal 'byor=
After diligently retaining what you had studied, You gave rise to realization of the many teachings as one taste. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Dharmapa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
stobs po che yi brgya la nyid/ / dngos med stobs ldan gdams pas bcom/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes ma hi pa/ / rnal 'byor=
The pride you had in your immense strength You conquered with the instructions on the power of insubstantiality. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Mahila, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
nor rdzas 'dod pa'i rtog pa kun/ / rtog med nam mkha'i ngang du nub/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes sa tsin+ta/ / rnal 'byor=
All your thoughts of longing for wealth You dissolved into the thoughtless state of the sky. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Achinta, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
rtsa rlung thig le'i rnal 'byor las/ / 'pho med bde chen ro yis myos/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes ba b+ha hi/ / rnal 'byor=
Through the yoga of the channels, winds, and drops You savored the taste of unchanging great bliss. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Babhahi, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
pad rtsal 'tsho zhing zhu bde'i lam/ / mthar phyin 'khrul pa'i dri ma sangs/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes nI li nA/ / rnal 'byor=
Making your living from lotus roots, you completed the path of melting bliss And purified the stains of delusion. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Nalina, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
b+hu bu ku yi brtul zhugs bskyang*/ / spyod 'jug gsungs shing mkha' la gshegs/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes zhi ba lha/ / rnal 'byor=
Leading the lifestyle of an idle loafer,[34] You taught the Bodhicaryāvatāra and rose into the sky. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Shāntideva, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
btsun mo lnga brgya'i 'khor dang bcas/ / 'dod yon ma spangs chos nyid rgyan/ / grub brnyes in+d+ra bo d+hi che/ / rnal 'byor=

For you, with your court of five hundred queens, Sense pleasures are not to be rejected but are ornaments of ultimate reality. {119} You who attained supreme accomplishment, Indrabhūti, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
gnyug ma'i don rtogs dur khrod nyul/ / smyon pa'i spyod pas 'jigs 'jigs lta/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes me ki pa/ / rnal 'byor=

Realizing the meaning of the natural state, you roamed the charnel grounds, Acting like a madman, with fearsome gaze. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Mekopa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
sems kyi ri bo rang rig pa'i/ / rtog rtses rgyun chad med pa brkos/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes ko Ta li/ / rnal 'byor=
With the mattock of awareness You continuously dug the mountain of the mind. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Togchepa,[35] lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
mgar gyi bzo yis rang rgyud kyi/ / rnam rtog nyon mongs mtha' dag sbyangs/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes kam+b+ha ri/ / rnal 'byor=
You used the blacksmith’s craft to purify The concepts and defilements in your mind. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Kamparipa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
ye shes mkha' 'gros smin grol rtsal/ / grub mchog kun gyi 'dren pa mdzad/ / grub brnyes dza lan+d+ha ra pa/ / rnal 'byor=
Matured and liberated by a wisdom ḍākinī, You were the guide of all the supreme siddhas. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Jālandhara, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
gnyis med rtogs pa'i sgra gcan gyis/ / gnyis 'dzin zla ba dbyings su zos/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes rA hu la/ / rnal 'byor=
With the rogue planet[36] of nondual realization You eclipsed the moon of dualistic beliefs. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Rāhula, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
mkhas pa smra ba gtsor mdzad pa/ / rgas tshe bsgoms pas ye shes 'char/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes d+harma pa/ / rnal 'byor=
As a scholar, you spent most of your life teaching, But in old age you meditated, and wisdom arose. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Dharmapa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
stong pa nyid kyi snod khur nas/ / bde chen 'bras bu rtag tu slong*/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes d+ho ka ri/ / rnal 'byor=
Carrying the bowl of emptiness, you always begged for alms And garnered thus the fruit, great bliss. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Dhokaripa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
zhing pa'i las kyis rnam rtog sbyangs/ / nam mkhar 'phags te 'gro mang sgrol/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes me d+hi ni/ / rnal 'byor=
Through farmer’s work, you purified conceptual thoughts; Rising into the sky, you liberated many beings. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Medhina, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
pad skyes 'phags pa'i gdams pa nos/ / zhag bdun bsgoms pas 'ching las grol/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes sang+ka dza/ / rnal 'byor=

Born from a lotus, you received instruction from a noble one, And by meditating for seven days you were released from bondage. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Saṅkaja, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
pho nya'i lam gyis bde chen grub/ / 'khor lo sdom pa'i sku ru bzhengs/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes dril bu pa/ / rnal 'byor=
Through the path of the consort, you accomplished great bliss And arose in the body of Chakrasaṃvara. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Ghaṇḍhapa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
gnas chen nyer bzhir sgrub pa mdzad/ / bcu gnyis lo ru dri ma dag / dngos grub mchog brnyes dzo ki pa/ / rnal 'byor=
Practicing sādhana in the twenty-four sacred places, In twelve years you purified all stains. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Yogipa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
snang srid lus ngag yid gsum sdud/ / la la ra sa d+hU tir chud/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes tsa lu ki/ / rnal 'byor=

Gathering phenomenal existence into your body, speech, and mind, You guided the right and left channels into the central one. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Chaluki, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
sgra kun 'dab chags sgor sbyangs pas/ / grags stong dbyer med chos nyid rtogs/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes go ru ra/ / rnal 'byor=
By purifying all sounds as the songs of birds, You realized ultimate reality—sound and emptiness inseparable. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Gorura, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow. {120}
'khor ba blo log rim gnyis bsgoms/ / srid zhi mnyam nyid chen por gzigs/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes lu tsi ga / rnal 'byor=
Turning your mind from samsara, you trained in the two stages And saw existence and peace as the great sameness. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Luchika, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
nyal bzhin snang stong zung 'jug bsgoms/ / 'khrul pa'i rgya grol mkha' spyod gshegs/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes na gu Na/ / rnal 'byor=

As you slept, you meditated on the union of appearance and emptiness. Released from the bonds of delusion, you departed to a celestial land. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Naguṇa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
gtor mas 'dab chags kun tshims mdzad/ / gsang ste nang gi rnal 'byor brtson/ / grub brnyes dza ya nan+ti pa/ / rnal 'byor=
With torma offerings, you made all the birds content. In secret you were diligent in the inner yoga. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Jayānanti, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
dbul pos 'phags pa'i sprul pa la/ / khur ba phul bas rjes su bzung*/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes tsa pa ri/ / rnal 'byor=
Though poor, you offered pastries To the Ārya’s manifestation, and so he guided you. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Pachari, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
me tog rtog pa lam khyer gyis/ / chos kun mnyam pa nyid du grol/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes tsam+pa ka / rnal 'byor=
By taking the thought of a flower as the path You freed all phenomena in the state of sameness. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Champaka, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
ye shes mkha' 'gror tshem phul bas/ / snang stong zung 'jug gdams pas grol/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes b+hi k+Sha Na/ / rnal 'byor=

By offering your teeth to a wisdom ḍākinī, You were freed by her instructions on the union of appearance and emptiness. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Bhikṣhana, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
snum tshong 'byor pa'i dpal la brten/ / mtshan ma rang grol rtogs pa thob/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes me d+hi li/ / rnal 'byor=

Relying on the glory of your wealth as an oil merchant, You gained realization of the self-liberation of attributes. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Dhilipa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
rdza ma'i las kyi rtog pa dang*/ / mi rtog ye shes gnyis med 'dres/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes kum+b+ha ri/ / rnal 'byor=
As a potter, you integrated the concepts of your work Inseparably with the wisdom beyond concepts. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Kumbharipa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
bcud len grub pas skye bo rnams/ / don chen po la yud kyi 'god/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes tsarba Ti/ / rnal 'byor=
By accomplishing the extraction of essence You introduced many people instantly to the great goal. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Charpaṭipa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
grub thob gdams pas rgyud smin zhing*/ / rdza ma chags pas rang bzhin grol/ / grub brnyes ma Ni b+ha dra zhes/ / rnal 'byor dbang mo'i zhabs la 'dud/ /
With your mind matured by a siddha’s instructions, You broke your pitcher and were naturally freed. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Maṇibhadrā, queen of yogis, at your feet I bow.
khyim bdag bu mos gdams pas grol/ / dbu bcad slar la 'byor bar mdzad/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes me kha li/ / rnal 'byor dbang mo'i=
Daughter of a householder, liberated by the instructions, You cut off your head and had it restored again. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Mekhali, queen of yogis, at your feet I bow.
nag po spyod pas rjes su bzung*/ / spros bcad brda' don bla mar phul/ / grub brnyes ka na kha la zhes/ / rnal 'byor dbang mo'i=
Guided by Kṛiṣhṇāchāri, you offered your teacher The symbol of your having cut through elaborations. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Kanakhalā, queen of yogis, at your feet I bow.
sgra rtog nam mkha'i dbyings su stor/ / snang grags phyag rgya chen por shar/ / grub brnyes ka la ka la pa/ / rnal 'byor=
As you lost the concept of sound in the expanse of the sky, Appearances and sound arose as the Great Seal. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Kalakala, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
tshom bu phyi dang nang bsres pas/ / stong nyid snying rje zung 'jug rtogs/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes kan+ta li/ / rnal 'byor=
Sewing things together on the outer and inner levels, You realized the union of emptiness and compassion. {121} You who attained supreme accomplishment, Kandhalipa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
kun brtag gzhan dbang rtswa thag nyid/ / dngos grub ngo bo gnyis med rtogs/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes d+ha hu li/ / rnal 'byor=
From the grass rope of imputed and dependent realities You attained siddhi and realized the nondual nature. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Dhahulipa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
gnas chen nyer bzhir sman mchog btsal/ / mkha' la 'phur pa'i rdzu 'phrul thob/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes u d+hi li/ / rnal 'byor=

Seeking special medicines in the twenty-four sacred places, You gained the miraculous ability to fly through the sky. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Udhilipa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
chung ma'i thod pas phor snod dang*/ / bu tsha'i rus pas rgyan drug byas/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes ka pA la/ / rnal 'byor=
From your wife’s skull you made a cup, And from your sons’ bones, the six ornaments. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Kapālapa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
rgyal srid dpung gi bkod pa la/ / brten nas lam gyi mngon rtogs 'byangs/ / grub brnyes ki ra ba la pa/ / rnal 'byor=
Making use of the disposition of your kingdom and army, You refined your realization of the path. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Kiravalapa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
'phags pas dbang stsal gdams pas grol/ / 'dod rgu'i char pas rgud pa skyabs/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes sa ka ra/ / rnal 'byor=

Empowered by the Noble One, liberated by his instructions, You protected those in trouble with a rain of all that they desired. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Sakarapa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
snang srid bza' dang btung bar spyad/ / nyi zla gnyis kyang 'jigs nas bros/ / grub brnyes sarba b+hak+Sha pa/ / rnal 'byor=
Phenomenal existence you ate as food and drink, And even the sun and moon ran off in fright. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Sarvabhakṣhapa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
dpal gyi ri la rtag tu bzhugs/ / 'gro la grub chen brgyad po stsal/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes klu'i byang chub/ / rnal 'byor=
Ever dwelling on Mount Shrī Parvata, You bestow on beings the eight great siddhis. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Nāgabodhi, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
bla ma'i rjes bsnyags rgyal srid dor/ / gzugs 'tshong ma yi khol po mdzad/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes dA ri ka / rnal 'byor=
Pursuing your teacher, you gave up your kingdom And worked as a prostitute’s servant. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Dārikapa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
dgyes rdor bris sku ting 'dzin thob/ / lha dang 'byung po bla 'og rjes/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes su ta li/ / rnal 'byor=
Achieving concentration with a painting of Hevajra, You reversed the positions of deity and demon. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Putalipa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
mchil l+h+wam sgrar bcas rgyug pa la/ / mngon zhen lam khyer gdams pa grol/ / dgos grub mchog brnyes pa na ha/ / rnal 'byor=
Running along to the sound of your boots, you were freed By instructions for taking attachment as the path. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Panahapa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
skyed tshal khu byug sgra la brten/ / kun rtog ye shes chen por shar/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes ko ki la/ / rnal 'byor=
In a grove, you relied on the sound of the cuckoo’s song, And all thoughts arose as the great primal wisdom. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Kokilapa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
rang gzugs mdzes pa'i nga rgyal can/ / tshogs drug rang grol lam du longs/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes a nang+ga/ / rnal 'byor=
Vain and proud of your handsome looks, You took as the path the self-liberation of the six consciousnesses. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Anonga, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
rgyal chen rigs 'khrungs nges 'byung blos/ / smyon pa'i spyod pas lam mchog 'byongs/ / grub brnyes lak+Sh+mI ka ra/ / rnal 'byor dbang mo'i zhabs la 'dud/ /

Born in the family of a great king, you trained on the supreme path By renouncing the world and behaving like a lunatic. {122} You who attained supreme accomplishment, Lakṣhmīnkarā, queen of yogis, at your feet I bow.
phyi nang tshad med dga' ba bzhis/ / 'jig rten chos brgyad 'khrul pa zhig / dngos grub mchog brnyes sa mu dra/ / rnal 'byor=

With the four boundless attitudes outwardly and inwardly the four joys, You destroyed the delusion of the eight ordinary preoccupations.[37] You who attained supreme accomplishment, Samudrapa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
dngul chu'i bcud len la brten nas/ / 'khor bcas 'chi med lus su gyur/ / dngos grub mchog brnyes byA li pa/ / rnal 'byor dbang phyug zhabs la 'dud/ /
Making use of an elixir of mercury, You and your companions attained immortality. You who attained supreme accomplishment, Vyālipa, lord of yogis, at your feet I bow.
gus pas bstod pa phul ba'i mthus/ / las dang bag chags dri ma sangs/ / rnam grol dus mnyam ye shes rgyas/ / grub mchog khyed dang mtshungs par shog /

By the power of this offering of devotion and praise, May the stains of my deeds and habitual tendencies be purified, And may liberation and wisdom simultaneously grow. Supreme siddhas, may I become the same as you!

ces pas byar bstod/ de nas gsol ba gnas pa ni/ grub chen re re'am spyi bsdus kyi gsol 'debs gzhan nas 'byung ba ji ltar rigs pa 'dir sbyar/ rdo rje 'chang chen lU yi lI pa la/ / sogs gong gi phyag 'tshal gyi chog mtha'/ mA na go rak+Sha la gsol ba 'debs/ / zhes bsgyur ba dang/ gsham gyi sho lo ka gcig po bzhag nas/

Next, to pray[38] to the mahāsiddhas, use here any suitable prayers to the individual mahāsiddhas or general prayers that occur elsewhere. Recite the verses from the homage section above,[39] “To the great Vajradhara, Lūyipa, Līlapa…,” adapting the end of the quatrain: “Mīnapa, and Gorakṣha I pray,” and adding at the end the following single quatrain:
byams dang snying rje phyogs med 'byongs pa dang*/ / don dam lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes de/ / grub mchog rnal 'byor rnams kyis rtogs pa ltar/ / bdag gis mngon sum rtogs par byin gyis rlobs/ /
Grant the blessings that I may train In love and compassion impartially And truly realize the ultimate, coemergent gnosis, Just as did the great accomplished yogis.
ces brjod/ bla ma rgyang 'bod rgyas bsdus gang bde skabs 'dir sbyor na'ang chog / de nas bshags pa sogs yan lag lha ma rnams ni/

At this point you may add a prayer for calling the lama from afar (bla ma rgyang ’bod), in a detailed or condensed version, as you like. After that, go through the remaining branches, beginning with confession.
thog med dus nas nyon mongs dbang gyur pas/ / sgo gsum sgo nas rang bzhin bcas pa'i sdig / bgyis dang bgyid stsal yid rang bgyis pa kun/ / gnong 'gyod sdom pa'i sems kyis mthol zhing bshags/ /

Since time without beginning, under the influence of defilements, I have physically, verbally, and mentally committed negative deeds, both naturally negative and in violation of edicts; I have incited others to do them, and I have rejoiced at such deeds. All these I acknowledge and confess, with a mind full of remorse and determination to refrain in the future.
khyad par rdo rje theg pa'i lta spyod la/ / shing brtson dman pas ji bzhin sgrub ma nus/ / the tshom sel zhugs ma tshor dam las nyams/ / gsang sngags 'chol par gyur sogs snying nas bshags/ /

In particular, due to my lack of diligence regarding the view and conduct Of the Vajrayāna, I have been unable to practice it as I should. Indulging in doubts and distinctions, I have unconsciously deteriorated the commitments And deviated from the secret mantras: such deeds I confess from the depth of my heart.
skyes mchog sras dang bcas pa'i rnam thar dang*/ / gzhan yang 'gro kun sgo gsum dge ba'i tshogs/ / byas dang byed 'gyur da lta mdzad rnams la/ / rab tu dga' ba'i yid kyis yi rang ngo*/ /

With delighted mind I rejoice In the lives and examples of the supreme beings and their heirs And in all the virtuous deeds as well that all beings have done, Will do, and are performing now, with their bodies, speech, and minds. {123}
sngags dang 'brel ba'i legs spyad phra mo yang*/ / rlabs chen dge bas bsod nams char mi nye/ / des na gsang ba chen po'i phyogs bslan pa'i/ / rmad byung dge la lhag par rjes yi rang*/ /
Great waves of virtue cannot approach the merit Of the smallest good deed connected with the mantras. I rejoice even more, therefore, in the wondrous virtue Related to the Great Secret.
'gro kun phan cing dge bar bgyid pa'i slad/ / chos kyi rgyal po sras dang bcas rnams kyis/ / gang la gang 'dul zab dang rgya che ba'i/ / chos kyi 'khor lo rgyun du bskor du gsol/ /

In order to benefit all beings and incite them to virtue, I request the kings of dharma and their heirs To continuously turn the wheel of dharma, The profound and extensive teachings that train according to need.
bzod dka' srid pa'i 'khrul 'khor rgyun ring ba/ / myur du gcod nas ma gyur lus can rnams/ / gtan bder 'god byed rdo rje nA da'i dbyangs/ / phyogs dus ris su ma chad sgrogs par mdzod/ /

Swiftly cut the long stream of the unbearable cycle of delusion that is existence, And make the melodious vajra sound That brings lasting happiness to living beings who have been our mothers Resound impartially throughout all space and time.
chos kyi sku la 'jig pa mi mnga' yang*/ / gzugs sku zhing gzhan don la mi gshegs par/ / mgon med snyigs ma'i 'gro la rjes brtse bas/ / mya ngan ma 'da' yun ring bzhugs par 'tshal/ /

Though for the body of truth there is no coming into being and perishing, I beseech you not to depart in your form body to benefit other buddha fields But, out of compassion for the protectorless beings in the age of degeneration, To remain for a long time without passing into nirvana.
mkha' spyod zhing bzang bsten pa'i skal med pa/ / 'jig rten 'dir gnas lus can yongs kyi mgon/ / rdo rje theg pa ston pa'i slob dpon ru/ / sprul nas thub bstan ji srid rtag bzhugs gsol/ /

Protectors of beings living in this world Who do not have the fortune to follow you in wonderful celestial lands, Manifest as masters teaching the Vajrayāna And constantly remain as long as the Buddha’s doctrine endures.
'gro kun bla med byang chub thob don du/ / skyabs mchog khyed la rtag par skyabs mchi zhing*/ / thun mong khyad par dam tshig sdom pa rnams/ / deng nas blangs te tshul bzhin bsgrub par bgyi'o/ /

In order that all beings attain unsurpassed enlightenment, I will always take refuge in you, the supreme refuge, And henceforth I will take and properly practice The common and extraordinary commitments and vows.
'dis mtshon zag bcas zag med dge ba'i mthus/ / 'gro kun srid pa'i 'ching ba kun las grol/ / bla ma grub thob tshogs kyis rjes bzung nas/ / tshe gcig mi slob lam mchog mthar phyin shog /

By the power of tainted and untainted virtue, epitomized by this prayer, May every being be freed from all the fetters of existence, And, guided by the host of accomplished teachers, May they complete the supreme path beyond training in one lifetime.
bdag gis dus gsum dge ba ci spyod pas/ / nam mkha'i mtha' klas gyur pa'i sems can rnams/ / bla med rdo rje theg pa'i snod gyur te/ / kun bzang rdo rje 'dzin pa myur thob shog /

Through all my practice of virtue in the three times, May all beings, who are as limitless as space, Become vessels for the unsurpassed Vajrayāna And swiftly attain the level of Samantabhadra Vajradhara.
de nas tshogs mchod 'bul ba ni/ dam tshig gi rdzas su 'os pa'i bza' bca' btung ba'i rigs 'byor pa bshams/ nang mchod bdud rtsis sbran/ oM sum+b+has bsang*/ oM swab+hAwas sbyang*/

Next, perform the feast offering. Set out whatever food and drink you have that are suitable as samaya ingredients and sprinkle them with the nectar of the inner offering. Cleanse them with oṁ sumbhani…and purify them with oṁ svabhāva….

tshogs rdzas rnams mi dmigs par stong pa nyid du gyur/ stong pa'i ngang las tshogs rdzas rnams kyi 'og tu yaM las rlung*/ raM las me'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du a las ye shes kyi ka pA la yangs shing rgya che ba'i nang du sha lnga bdud rtsi lnga ye shes lnga zhu ba las byung ba'i tshogs rdzas zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi bdud rtsi'i rgya mtsho chen por gyur/

The feast-offering ingredients become emptiness, devoid of concepts. From that state of emptiness, under the feast-offering ingredients, there appears a syllable yaṃ, from which manifests the wind. {124} From the syllable raṃ, there manifests the mandala of fire. On top of it is the letter A, from which appears a vast, open wisdom kapāla. Inside it, the five fleshes and the five nectars melt into the five wisdoms, from which the feast-offering ingredients arise as a great ocean of untainted wisdom nectar.
oM AHhU~M ha hoHhrIH lan gsum/
Say oṁ āḥ hūṁ ha hoḥ hrīḥ three times.

na mo thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i tshogs kyi 'khor lo rgya chen po/ rang bzhin rnam par dag pa skye ba med pa/ mtshan nyid rnam par dag pa A li kA li/ ngo bo rnam par dag pa sha lnga bdud rtsi lngas rgyas btab pa 'di nyid/ byin rlabs kyi rtsa ba rtsa brgyud bla ma rnams kyi zhal du

namo The vast wheel of the feast offering, skillful means and wisdom inseparable, Is sealed with the perfectly pure nature, unborn, With perfectly pure attributes, the vowels and consonants, And the perfectly pure essence, the five fleshes and five nectars. This I offer to the root and lineage teachers, the root of blessings—
ga Na tsakra pU dza me g+ha sa mu dra s+pha ra Na sa ma ye hU~M/
gaṇacakra pūja megha samudra sapharaṇa samaye hūṁ
de bzhin du sbyar te/
Repeat these lines with the following adaptations:
na mo thabs dang shes rab= nas/ rgyas btab pa 'di nyid dngos grub kyi rtsa ba yi dam lha tshogs rnams kyi zhal du/ sogs/

namo The vast wheel of the feast offering, skillful means and wisdom inseparable… …the five fleshes and five nectars. This I offer to the hosts of yidam deities, the root of accomplishments— gaṇachakra…
na mo nas/ 'di nyid phrin las kyi rtsa ba mkha' 'gro chos skyong srung ma'i tshogs dang bcas pa rnams kyi=
namo The vast wheel of the feast offering… This I offer to the ḍākinīs and the hosts of protectors and guardians of the teachings, the root of activities…
na mo nas/ 'di nyid dam tshig gi rtsa ba mched grogs rdo rje spun grogs rnams kyi zhal du sogs
namo… This I offer to our fellow practitioners, vajra brothers and sisters, who are the root of the samaya…
slar yar byin 'bebs ni/
After this, invoke the descent of blessings:

dbyings bde gsal mi rtog pho brang cher/ / rje rdo rje 'chang chen 'gro ba'i mgon/ / de rang la snang ba skyabs kyi gtso/ / pha drin can rtsa ba'i bla ma yang*/ / khyed rnam 'phrul mkha' la sprin bzhin btibs/ / 'dir gshegs tshogs kyi mchod pa bzhes/ /

In the expanse of reality, the great palace of absence of thought, bliss and clarity, Lord, great Vajradhara, protector of beings, Principal refuge, appearing to itself, Kind father, root teacher, Gather with your manifestations like clouds in the sky. Come here and accept this feast offering.
gnas khang 'di la byin phobs la/ / tshogs gtor 'di la bcud cig chugs/ / 'dir 'dus rnal 'byor bdag cag la/ / mchog dang thun mong dngos grub stsol/ /
Bless this practice place, Infuse this feast torma with potent essence, And bestow on us practitioners assembled here The supreme and common accomplishments.
oM ma hA gu ru tsa tu rA shI ti sid+d+hi la b+d+ha dz+nyA na A be sha ya a a/
oṁ mahā guru caturā śīti siddhi labdha jñāna āveśaya a ā

yul dbus 'gyur ma ga d+ha yi char/ / ma 'gro ba'i don du sku bltams pa'i/ / rje rnal 'byor dbang phyug grub pa'i tshogs/ / khyod rnam 'phrul= 'dir gshegs= gnas khang= tshogs gtor= 'dir 'dus= mchog dang=

You who took birth in the central land of Magadha For the benefit of mother beings, Hosts of accomplished masters of yoga, Gather with your manifestations like clouds in the sky. Come here and accept this feast offering. Bless this practice place, Infuse this feast torma with potent essence, And bestow on us practitioners assembled here The supreme and common accomplishments.
oM ma hA=
oṁ mahā guru catura shiti siddhi labdha jñana abeshaya a a
yul rgya gar shar phyogs yul ljongs su/ / ma 'gro ba'i= sogs gong ltar rigs 'gre/
You who took birth in the east of India, For the benefit of mother beings…and so on, repeating as above.
yul rgya gar lho phyogs yul ljongs su/ / ma 'gro ba'i don du= sogs/
You who took birth in the south of India, For the benefit of mother beings…and so on.
yul rgya gar nub phyogs yul ljongs su/ / ma 'gro ba'i sogs/
You who took birth in the west of India, For the benefit of mother beings…and so on. {125}
yul rgya gar byang phyogs yul ljongs su/ / ma 'gro ba'i sogs/
You who took birth in the north of India, For the benefit of mother beings…and so on.
rigs rgyal rigs bram ze rje'u rigs/ / 'bangs dmangs rigs phal par sku 'khrungs pa'i/ / rje rnal 'byor dbang phyug sogs/
You who took birth in the royal caste, the brahmin caste, the merchant caste, As noble citizens, or of common caste— Lords, hosts of accomplished masters of yoga…and so on.
yab rnal 'byor dbang po mtha' yas kyi/ / ma lhan cig spyod pa gsang ba'i yum/ / sring dga' bzhi'i nyams ster thams cad kyang*/ / khyed rnam 'phrul sogs/
Fathers, infinite lords of yoga, Mothers, your secret consorts, And sisters, bestowing the experiences of the four joys—all of you Gather with your manifestations like clouds in the sky…and so on.
pho rtogs shing grol pa brgyad cu dang*/ / mo rtogs shing grol pa'i sring mo bzhi/ / rje grub thob brgyad cu rtsa bzhi'i tshogs/ / khyed rnam 'phrul mkha' la sprin bzhin sogs/

Eighty yogis who have attained realization and liberation, And four yoginīs who have attained realization and liberation— Hosts of the eighty-four siddhas, Gather with your manifestations like clouds in the sky…and so on.
stug po'i zhing khams 'jigs med par/ / dpa' bo dpa' mo 'bum sde'i dbus/ / dkyil 'khor khyab bdag rigs lnga'i rgyal/ / bcom ldan he ru ka pa yang/ / rnam 'phrul= zhes pa nas/

In the densely arrayed buddha field free of fear, In the midst of hundreds of thousands of dakas and ḍākinīs, Buddha of the five families, all-pervading lord of the mandala, Bhagavān Heruka, Gather with your manifestations like clouds in the sky…and so on, to
gu ru de wa DA ki ni dz+nyA na A be sha ya a a/
guru deva ḍākinī jñāna āveśaya a ā
mi g.yo 'og min nyams dga'i zhing*/ / dag pa bde stong mkha' spyod gnas/ / rgyal ba dgyes pa'i bde skyed yum/ / rdo rje phag mo mkha' 'gro'i gtso/ / rnam 'phrul mkha' la=

In the delightful unexcelled buddha field of the unwavering state, The pure celestial realm of bliss and emptiness, Mother creator of the bliss that delights the buddhas, Vajravarāhī, queen of the ḍākinīs, Gather with your manifestations like clouds in the sky…and so on.
bdud tshogs kun 'dul phrin las zhing*/ / dur khrod chen po'i gnas brgyad na/ / bgegs 'joms 'dod don kun sgrub pa'i/ / dpal ldan mgon po lcam dral yang*/ / rnam 'phrul mkha' la=

In the eight great charnel grounds, The realm of activities where the whole host of demons is subdued, Glorious protectors and your consorts and retinue, Who vanquish obstacle makers and fulfill all wishes, Gather with your manifestations like clouds in the sky…and so on.

bla ma yi dam mkha' 'gro'i tshogs/ / rigs kyi cod pan ldems se ldem/ / dar gyi cod pan pu ru ru/ / rgyan cha mang po khro lo lo/ / rol mo mang po di ri ri/ / glu len gar byed khyugs se khyug / 'khor tshogs 'bum sde sha ra ra/ / sgyu ma'i rang snang rjen ne ne/ / gtad med rig pa sa la la/ brjod med dbyings su tha la la/ / bde ba chen por phri li li/ / byin gyis brlab phyir gshegs su gsol/ / gnas mchog 'di ru byin phobs la/ / sgrub mchog bdag la dngos grub stsol/ / bgegs dang log 'dren bar chad sol/ / 'khor gsum gnyis med par 'dres/ /

Hosts of teachers, yidams, and ḍākinīs, With the tasseled crowns of your family swinging to and fro, Silk ribbons fluttering, Your numerous ornaments tinkling, A multitude of musical instruments resounding, Moving here and there with songs and dances, Your hundreds of thousands of retinues whirling around, Illusory self-appearance, nakedly vivid, Unfixated awareness, clear and radiant, Evanescent in the inexpressible expanse, Dancing in great bliss, In order to bless us, come, I pray, Bestow your blessings on this sublime place. Grant us the supreme accomplishment. Dispel obstacles due to spirits that obstruct and lead us astray. Mingle with us in the state where there are no dualistic concepts with regard to the three spheres. {126}
gu ru de wa DA ki ni dz+nyA na A be sha ya a A:
guru deva ḍākinī jñāna āveśaya a ā
zhes brjod la bar mtshams rnams su DA dril sogs rol mos bskul/ de nas las kyi rdo rjes lag g.yon thod pa bdud rtsis gang ba bzung*/ g.yas rtse gsum phyag rgyas steng 'og kha sbyor du bzung ste/

As you recite this, make the invocation to the music of the ḍāmaru, bell, and suchlike at the end of each verse. Next, the shrine master should take in their left hand a skull cup filled with nectar and cover it with their right hand in the trident gesture.
'dir ni chos rnams bzang por ltos/ / 'dus pa rnams la the tshom med/ / bram ze khyi dang gdol pa gsum/ / rang bzhin gcig tu dgongs te rol/ /
Look at the perfect ingredients here. May there be no doubt among those who are assembled: Consider that brahmins, dogs, and outcastes Are of the same nature, and enjoy!
a ho ma hA su khaM/
a ho mahā sukhaṃ
tshogs kyi gtso bo nas brtsams te bskor/ de dag gis/
Go around the assembly, beginning with the central figure. They take it, saying:
bde gshegs chos la rin thang med/ / 'dod chags la sogs dri ma bral/ / gzung dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba/ / de bzhin nyid la bdag phyag 'tshal/ /
The dharma of the sugatas is priceless, Free of attachment and other stains, Free of subject-object duality. To the ultimate nature we pay homage.
a ho ma hA su khaM/
a ho mahā sukhaṃ
zhes blangs la/ tshogs phud 'bul ba ni/
Then, offer the first part of the feast:
zhal zas ro brgya ldan cing yid 'phrog pa/ / legs sbyar 'di ni bla ma lha tshogs la/ / dad pas phul bas 'gro ba 'di dag gis/ / 'byor ldan ting 'dzin zas la spyod par shog /

This deliciously prepared food offering, Bewitching with its hundred tastes, I offer with faith to the teacher and host of deities. May these beings have the fortune to enjoy the food of concentration.
oM ma hA gu ru badz+ra d+ha ra tsa tu rA shI ti sid+d+hi la b+d+ha bud+d+ha bod+d+hi satwa wI ra DA ki ni sa pa ri wA re b+h+yaH
oṁ mahā guru vajradhara caturā śīti siddhi labdha buddha bodhisattva vīra ḍākinī sapari vāri bhyaḥ
na maH sarba ta thA ga te b+h+yo bi shwa mu khe b+h+yaHsarba thA khaM ut+ga te s+pha ra Na i maM ga ga na khaM gr-ih+Ne daM ba lin+ta swAhA/
namaḥ sarva tathāgate bhyo viśva mukhe bhyaḥ sarvathā khaṃ udgate sapharaṇa imaṃ gagana khaṃ ghṛhane daṃ balinta svāhā

zhes pa'am/ oM a kA ro btags pa lan bdun gyi bla ma grub thob 'khor bcas la phul/ oM shrI he ru ka badz+ra yo gi ni sa pa ri wA ra a kA ro sogs/ lan gsum gyis yi dam/ oM shrI ma hA kA la ya shA sa na sogs nas mA ra ya hUM phaT kyis mgon po chos skyong tshogs la 'bul/

Or add oṁ akāro seven times while offering to the teacher and siddhas and their retinue; oṁ śrī heruka vajra yoginī sapari vāra akāro…and so on three times for the yidam deity, and oṁ śrī mahākālaya śāsana…and so on, up to…māraya hūṁ phaṭ for Mahākāla and the host of dharma protectors. With
oM AHhU~M ha ho hrIH pheM badz+ra A ral+li hoH dzaHhU~M ba~M~M hoH badz+ra DA ki nI sa ma ya s+t+waM dr-i sh+ya hoH oM kha kha sogs
oṁ āḥ hūṁ ha hoḥ hrīḥ phem vajra aralli hoḥ jaḥ hūṁ baṃ hoḥ vajra ḍākinī samaya stvaṃ dri śya hoḥ oṁ kha kha and so on
mkha' 'gro spyi gtor ltar gyis mgron gzhan rnams la phul/ nang mchod thogs la/
as for the general torma offering to the ḍākinīs, make the offering to the other guests. Holding up the inner offering, offer it by saying:

oM mchod do/ / dman pa'i yul las rab 'das shing*/ / rgyal ba kun gyi dam tshig mchog / dngos grub kun gyi gzhir gyur pa/ / bdud rtsi mchog gis mchod par bgyi/ / sgrib pa'i dri ma kun sel zhing*/ / rtog pa kun las nges grol ba/ / bla na med pa'i byang chub sems/ / bde ba chen pos mnyes gyur cig /

oṁ I offer. The supreme samaya of all the buddhas, Which utterly transcends inferior objects And is the ground of all accomplishments, I offer with this sublime nectar. Dispel all the stains of obscurations, Free us definitively from all ordinary thoughts, And be pleased with this offering of great bliss, The unsurpassed bodhichitta. {127}

ces pa rnams kyis 'bul/ nang gi sreg blugs kyis tshul gyis tshogs la longs spyad/ lhag ma bsdus la lam sgron btsugs/ bsang sbyang*/ stong pa'i ngang las a las ye shes kyi ka pA la yangs shing rgya che ba'i nang du lhag ma'i gtor ma bzang zhing rgya che ba bdud rtsi'i rgya mtsho chen por gyur/

Enjoy the feast offering in the manner of an inner fire offering. Plant a light on the remainders that have been collected, and cleanse and purify them. From the state of emptiness appears a letter A, from which manifests a vast and spacious wisdom kapāla, in which the remainders torma becomes a great ocean of nectar, excellent and vast.
oM AHhU~M ha hoHhrIH
oṁ āḥ hūṁ ha hoḥ hrīḥ
a kA ro lan gsum/
Say the akaro mantra three times.

phyi rol sgo drung na gnas pa'i 'byung po 'chol ba'i tshogs dam tshig gi cho ga blta ba la mi dbang ba rnams la sbyin no/ / rdo rje theg pa la gsang ba mchog gi rnal 'byor spyod pa'i skal pa dang ldan par gyur cig /

It is given to the host of wild jungpo spirits abiding at the outer gate, who are not allowed to see the samaya rituals. May they come to possess the fortune to practice the yoga of the supreme secret in the Vajrayāna.
oM uts+tshi pa li ti b+hak+Sha si swAhA/
oṁ ucchiṣṭa baliṅgta bhakśayi svāhā
zhes pas phyi rol du btang la drag sngags sogs kyis mtshams bcas/ de nas rdo rje'i glu blang ba ni/
Take the torma outside and set the boundary with wrathful mantras and so on. Then sing the vajra song:

kol+la i reTaTha a bol+la/ / ma m+mu Ni ri kak+ko la/ / g+ha Na kri pa ta ho badz+dza i/ / ka ru Ni ki a a Ni ro lA/ / tA hiM ba la khAdz+dza I/ / gA DIM ma a NA bidz+dza a i/ ha le ka liny+tsa ra pa ni a i/ dud+hu ra badz+dzi a i/ tsa u pa ma kats+tshu ri sih+la/ / ka pu ra las i a i/ / ma la in+d+ha na sA li dza/ / ta hiM b+ha tu kha i a i/ / phreM kha Na khe Ta ka ran+te/ / shud+d+ha a shu d+d+ha N+Na ma na a i/ / ni raM su aM ga tsa Da pi/ / ta hiM dza pa ra ba sa Ni a i/ / ma la a tsa kun+tu ru ba Da i/ / Di Na Di ma ta hi na badz+dza a i/ /

kolla i reṭṭha a bolla mammu ṇiri kakkola ghaṇa kripita ho vajja i karuṇiki a a ṇirolā tāhiṃ vala khājja ī gāḍāṁ ma aṇā vijja a i hale kaliñca rapani a i dudhura vajji a i ca upama kaccha ri sahil kapura la sa i a i mala inddhana sālijaḥ tahiṃ bhatu kha i a i phreṃ khaṇa kheṭa karante śuddha aśurdhaṇaṇ mana a i ni raṃ ru aṃ ga caḍavi ha hi jaṃ parāva sāṇi a i mala acakuntu ruva a i ḍiṇa ḍima tahina vajja a i

ces sbyar ba'am/ yang na dkyus ltar thams cad rdzogs pa'i mthar sbyar bas kyang rung*/ gzhan yang rdo rje'i glu ci rigs blang*/ dngos sam yid kyi phyag rgyar sbyor ba'i bde stong la mnyam par bzhag go / de nas 'dod don gsol ba ni/

This song can be sung here or, alternatively, you may add it at the end after completing all the sections according to the general liturgy. Besides this, sing whatever vajra songs are appropriate. Meditate on the bliss-emptiness of union with the mudrā, real or imagined. Then pray for the fulfillment of your wishes:
sras bcas rgyal ba kun 'dus grub pa'i dbang*/ / mgon po khyed la zhu zhing gsol ba ni/ / phan bde'i 'byung gnas thub bstan dam pa'i chos/ / thos bsam sgrub pas rgyas par mdzad du gsol/ /

Lords of accomplishment, you who embody all the buddhas and their heirs, Protectors of beings, I request and pray to you. Bring about the spread, through listening, reflection, and practice, Of the sacred dharma, the Buddha’s teaching, source of benefit and happiness.
thar pa'i ded dpon bstan 'dzin bshes gnyen rnams/ / sku la snyun med phrin las rab rgyas pas/ / rtag tu sdug bsngal gyur pa'i 'gro ba rnams/ / thar pa'i bde la 'god par mdzad du gsol/ /

Ensure that the pilots to liberation, the spiritual friends who hold the teachings, Remain in good health and that their activities develop fully, So that beings who are always suffering Are brought to the happiness of liberation.
dam chos sgrub la brtson pa thams cad kyis/ / zab lam bla ma'i mos gus mthar phyin nas/ / spangs rtogs mthar son bla ma'i sa thob ste/ / gzhan phan tshad med 'grub par mdzad du gsol/ /

Enable all those who are diligent in practicing the sacred dharma To perfect the profound path through devotion to the teacher {128} And, by completing elimination and realization, to attain the level of the teacher, Bringing boundless benefit to others.
de ma thob kyi gnas skabs thams cad du'ang*/ / bla ma mchog gis rtag tu rjes 'dzin cing*/ / lus dang longs spyod dge bas mnyes byas te/ / brtse bas byin rlabs 'jug par mdzad du gsol/ /

Grant that in the meantime, until we achieve that level, The supreme teachers may constantly care for us; May we serve them with our bodies, possessions, and virtue, And may we receive their compassionate blessings.
grub mchog rnams kyi sku dang bdag gi lus/ / dbyer med rdo rje'i sku ru byin gyis rlobs/ / rnal 'byor dbang phyug ci gsung bsgrub pa dang*/ / gsung ngag dbyer med gsung gi rdo rjer shog /

May the supreme siddhas’ bodies and our bodies Become inseparable and be blessed as the adamantine body. May whatever the lords of yogis have taught And our own speech become inseparable as the vajra speech.
thugs kyi gsang ba'i mdzod kun 'dzin pa dang*/ / thugs yid dbyer med 'dres par byin gyis rlobs/ / bla ma dge ba'i bya ba kun bsgrubs nas/ / mdzad pa phrin las mtshungs par byin gyis rlobs/ /

May we hold the entire treasury of the secret of their minds And receive the blessing of their minds and ours mingling inseparably. May we receive the teachers’ blessings to accomplish all virtuous deeds And become equal to them in enlightened activities.
de nas lam dbang zhu ba'i thog mar phur tshugs gsol 'debs gang shes byas pas chog mod/ rgya gar ba'i gsung rgyun ni/

Next, to receive the path empowerment, first pray intently with any prayers you know, and give rise to intense devotion by reciting this prayer in particular, from the Indian oral tradition, as many times as you can:
grub chen brgyad cu rtsa bzhi la/ / phyag 'tshal snying nas gsol ba 'debs/ / bdag gi skyid sdug khyed kyis mkhyen/ / khyed las skyabs gzhan ma mchis so/ /
To the eighty-four great siddhas I pay homage and pray from the depths of my heart. You know all my happiness and suffering; I have no other refuge than you.

zhes tshar gang 'grub brjod cing mos gus drag tu bskyed/ de ltar gsol ba btab pas/ bla ma grub thob rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug rnams kyi dpral ba nas sku'i byin rlabs kyi rang bzhin g.yon rkyang ma dang rjes su 'brel ba'i kun da byang sems dkar po'i rgyun byung*/ rang gi dpral bar thim/ lus kyi dri ma dag / bum pa'i dbang thob/ sku rdo rje'i byin rlabs zhugs/

As a result of praying like this, from the foreheads of the teacher and siddhas, the lords of yogis, comes a stream of white bodhichitta essence—the blessings of the enlightened body, connected with the left kyangma channel. It dissolves into my own forehead, purifying the stains of the body, and I receive the vase empowerment; the blessings of the adamantine body enter me.

mgrin pa nas gsung gi byin rlabs kyi ngo bo g.yas ro ma dang rjes su 'brel ba'i rak+ta byang sems dmar po'i rgyun byung*/ rang gi mgrin par thim/ ngag gi dri ma dag / gsang ba'i dbang thob/ gsung rdo rje'i byin rlabs zhugs/

From their throats comes a stream of red bodhichitta essence—the blessings of the enlightened speech, connected with the right roma channel. It dissolves into my own throat, purifying the stains of speech, and I receive the secret empowerment; the blessings of the adamantine speech enter me.

smin mtshams nas thugs kyi byin rlabs dbu ma dang rjes su 'brel ba'i khu khrag 'dres pa'i byang sems byon/ rang gi smin mtshams su thim/ yid kyi dri ma dag / shes rab ye shes kyi dbang thob/ thugs rdo rje'i byin rlabs zhugs par gyur/

From between their eyebrows comes a mixture of white and red bodhichitta[40]—the blessings of the enlightened mind, connected with the central channel. It dissolves between my own eyebrows, purifying the stains of mind, and I receive the wisdom empowerment; the blessings of the adamantine mind enter me. {129}
de nas grub chen pho mo rnams kyis mgrin gcig tu ngo sprod kyi gdams pa stsal bar gyur/ /
Then the male and female mahāsiddhas, with one voice, bestow the pointing-out instruction:
ye shes 'di ni ches phra zhing*/ / rdo rje nam mkha'i dkyil lta bu/ / rdul bral mthar phyin zhi ba nyid/ / khyod kyi pha ni khyod nyid do/ /
This primordial wisdom is extremely subtle, Adamantine, like the midst of space, Free of defilement, ultimate, the state of peace; You are your own father.
gzhi nas ma bcos ye nas lhun grub la/ / tha mal rang lugs chen po bzhag pa na/ / skye 'chi med pa nam mkha'i klong yangs su/ / 'pho 'gyur med pa chos sku'i lus mthong 'gyur/ /

Fundamentally uncontrived, spontaneously present from the very beginning, When ordinary persons establish this great natural way, They will behold in the vast expanse of space, free of birth and death, The unchanging body that is the body of truth.
de ltar rdo rje'i tshig tu rtsal thob nas/ / bsam med ngang du cung zad glod der bzhag / ma bcos so ma rang shar lhan ne ba/ / lhun grub 'bad rtsol med pa'i ngang tu btang*/ /

Having received this, expressed in vajra words, Relax and remain for a little in the state beyond thought, Letting go in the state that is uncontrived, fresh, self-arising, vivid, Spontaneously present, and devoid of effort.
zhes pas gsal btab la cung zad mnyam par bzhag / des sgo gsum 'pho ba'i dri ma dag / dbang bzhi pa thob/ ye shes rdo rje'i byin rlabs rgyud la zhugs par gyur/ /

Refreshing your memory with these words, rest for a little while in meditation. By this means, the most subtle stains of the three doors are purified, I receive the fourth empowerment, And the blessings of adamantine gnosis enter my stream of being.
nongs bshags ni/
Confession of errors:
bdag ni mi shes bag med dbang gyur pas/ / ma rig nyes pa'i tshogs rnams gang bgyis pa/ / brtse ldan khyed kyi spyan sngar bshags par bgyi/ / thugs rje'i rang bzhin can gyis bzod par gsol/ /
All the faults and things I have done wrong On account of ignorance and carelessness I confess in your presence, you who are possessed of love. Please forgive them, you who are compassionate.
yig brgya lan gsum brjod/ slar yang mos gus drag tu bskyed la/
Recite the hundred-syllable mantra three times. Again, give rise to intense devotion:
skyabs mchog khyed ni 'gro ba'i don rab mdzad/ / chos kyi sku la 'gyur ba mi mnga' yang*/ / gzugs sku bdag gi lus la rab bskyod nas/ / brtse ba chen pos byin gyis rlabs tu gsol/ /
Supreme refuge, you who perfectly benefit beings, Although there is nothing that changes in the body of truth, I pray to you to stir from it in the form body And, out of great love, to bless my body.

ces gsol btab pas 'khor gyi lha tshogs thams cad bla ma'i dkyil 'khor la thim/ / grub thob pho mo thams cad gtso bo rdo rje 'chang la thim/ de nyid 'od phung gi rnam par ltem gyi zhu nas ngang la sib kyis thim pas sku gsung thugs kyi byin rlabs ma lus pa spar btab ba bzhin du rgyud la 'phos par gyur/ ces mos la chos nyid kyi rang ngo bskyang*/

As a result of this prayer, all the deities of the retinue dissolve into the mandala of teachers. All the male and female siddhas dissolve into the central figure of the mandala, Vajradhara. Vajradhara himself completely melts into a mass of light and dissolves into me, so that all the blessings of enlightened body, speech, and mind are transferred in their entirety into my stream of being, as if imprinted on it. Considering this, preserve the state of your own true nature, the ultimate reality.
smon lam gdab pa ni/
A prayer of aspiration:

skye zhing skye ba dag ni thams cad du/ / rigs bzang blos gsal nga rgyal med pa dang*/ / snying rje che zhing bla ma la gus brtan/ / rdo rje theg pa'i dam tshig la gnas shog / rdo rje dril bu la sogs rtag tu 'chang*/ / zab dang rgya che'i chos don rtogs pa dang*/ / go ku shU kra la sogs rtag bza' zhing*/ / mthar thug bde chen 'grub pa'i skal ldan shog / bde gshegs spyan lngar gnas lugs mkha' 'gro yis/ / dam bcas srung zhing dngos grub mchog stsol bar/ / thugs dam bcas shing rtag srung dngos grub ni/ / rnam gsum tshe 'di nyid la thob par shog /

In all my successive lives, May I be of good family, clear minded, and free of pride. May I have great compassion and firm devotion to the teacher And observe the commitments of the Vajrayāna. May I always hold the vajra, bell, and so forth, {130} Realize the meaning of the profound and extensive teachings, Always eat the five fleshes and five nectars, And ultimately have the good fortune to accomplish great bliss. May the ḍākinīs of the three places keep the promises they made In the presence of the sugatas and bestow the supreme siddhis; May I take the commitments and always keep them And in this very life attain the three kinds of accomplishment.
ces dang*/
And:

dpa' bo gnyis med mchod pas skye ba 'di la ni/ / sgrib pa zad dang phyag rgya'i dngos grub 'gyur bar shog / skye ba kun du mchog tu bde bar gshegs pa yi/ / grub pa'i 'jig rten dbus su 'gro ba nyid gyur cig /

By venerating the vīras without duality, in this life May I put an end to my obscurations and achieve the accomplishment of the mudrā. In all my lives may I be born in the midst of a world of accomplished beings Who have attained the highest bliss.
zhing dang nye ba'i zhing sogs bcu gnyis su/ / dam tshig brda' dang bde spyod rol pa yis/ / bu bzhin dgongs nas bdag sgrib dag gyur te/ / bde ba mchog gi sa la 'god par shog /

May those who enjoy the sacred pledges, symbols, and sensual enjoyments On the twelve [levels]—Domain, Inner Domain, and the rest[41]— Think of me as their child and purify my obscurations, Setting me on the level of supreme bliss.
bla ma'i zhabs la rtag tu 'dud byed cing*/ / rdo rje dbang mo'i zhabs dran gyur nas kyang*/ / btsun mo'i shU kra'i tshogs la rtag spyod cing*/ / gsang ba'i pad+mor rol zhing mchod byed shog /
Always bowing at the feet of the teachers, May I become the servant of the vajra queen, And, constantly enjoying the feast of the queen’s essence, May I venerate and revel in her secret lotus.
dpal ldan dpa' bo dpa' mo nyi shu bzhi'i/ / zhal mthong de yi ngo bor bdag gyur te/ / 'gro ba bde ma dam pas 'phongs rnams kyi/ / nyer 'tshe rin chen lta bur bdag gyur cig /
May I have the vision of the twenty-four Dākas and ḍākinīs and attain their nature, And may I become like a jewel, providing for the spiritual needs Of beings deprived of the supreme bliss.
rnam pa mang po'i bsod nams 'di dag kyang*/ / bdag gzhan dge ba mchog ni bskyed pa'i gzhi/ / de nyid gsal byed rmongs pa rab 'joms pa/ / 'gro la mi 'jigs ster ba'i mnga' bdag shog /

May these manifold merits Be the ground on which, for myself and others, the highest virtue grows. May I become a sovereign elucidating thatness, overcoming confusion, And bestowing fearlessness on beings.
rnam par rtog pa kun las 'das pa yis/ / bde chen 'khor lo zag pa med pa'i dbyings/ / A li kA li rtog med snyoms 'jug mar/ / bsags pa'i dge rnams yongs su bsngo bar bgyi/ /

Transcending all ordinary concepts, I fully dedicate the virtue I have accumulated To the nonconceptual absorption of [mastery of the] vowels and consonants, The untainted expanse of the wheel of great bliss.

bdag gi bsod nams 'di yis yang yang skye ba'i rim pa rnams su yang*/ / yun ring 'gro ba'i don bsgrub don la 'jigs pa med par dga' ba dang*/ / gtso bo sku yi 'od zer nam mkha' khyab par 'gro bas dbang bskur ba/ / srid gsum rdo rje rol par lhan cig de yi go 'phang thob par shog /

By this merit of mine, again and again in my different lives May I forever accomplish the benefit of beings and fearlessly delight in the ultimate teachings. May the light rays from the principal deity fill space and bestow empowerment, And may the three worlds revel in the Diamond [Vehicle] and together attain its level. {131}

rnam rtog gti mug grong khyer mtha' dag bsal nas he ru ka gtso mkha' 'gro ma'i/ / 'khor los yongs bskor rgyal ba bla med ye shes 'byung gnas thar pa dam pa'i grong*/ / sbyin pa la sogs rnams kyis 'gro ba'i yid la re ba yang dag rdzogs pa'i mchog / 'di ni shin tu brtse ba tshe ldan 'phags pa'i dpal 'byor rtag par myong bar shog /

Having cleared away the whole city of concepts and bewilderment, may the buddhas—the herukas, surrounded by the wheel of ḍākinīs— Who are the source of the highest gnosis and grant us the supreme city of liberation, Completely fulfill the hopes that beings entertain, And may we constantly experience the glory and wealth of the most loving noble ones.

ces thun mong ma yin pa'i smon lam rgya cher gdab/ de nas bkra shis ni/ rgyal mtshan rtse mo sogs dang*/ phun sum tshogs pa mnga' ba sogs rgyal ba'i bka' las 'byung ba zhig gis thog drangs te 'brel chags par brjod/ mthar/ nyin mo bde legs sogs dang*/

With this, make extraordinary aspirations on a vast scale. Then recite prayers for auspiciousness. Begin by reciting “Like the wish-fulfilling jewel on the top of the victory banner…,”[42] “Possessed of all perfection…,” and other prayers taken from the scriptures, one after the other. At the end say, “May the morning be blessed…,”[43] and so on, and

dpal ldan bla mas deng 'dir stsol/ / sangs rgyas rnams kyis deng 'dir stsol/ / de bzhin du 'don pa spos la/ dam chos tshogs kyis/ dge 'dun rnams kyis= mes po yis kyang = dbang po yis kyang = 'jig rten skyong bas= dkar phyogs skyong bas deng 'dir stsol/ / zhes sogs bya zhing me tog 'thor/ rol mo'i sgra 'jam la snyan par bsgrag go /

Glorious teacher, grant this today. Buddhas, grant this today. And likewise, add the same ending to Sacred teachings… Sangha assemblies… Forefathers and ancestors… Sovereigns and rulers… Protectors of the world… Virtuous protectors, grant this today. As you do this, throw flowers, to the soft and melodious strains of musical instruments.
gsang sngags ston pa rdo rje slob dpon nyid/ / mchod la bsod nams phung po tshad med pa/ / rgyud rnams kun las ched du bsngags pa'i don/ / gsal bar brjod 'dir blo ldan yi rang byos/ /

The mass of merit gained from venerating A vajra master who teaches the secret mantras is boundless. Such veneration, specifically praised in all the tantras, Is clearly expressed here—the wise should thus rejoice!
snying nas gus pas mchod cing gsol btab na/ / gdon mi za bar byin gyis rlobs 'gyur pas/ / rdo rje theg la zhugs pa'i skal bzang rnams/ / chos spyod kun gyi mchog 'dir brtson par rigs/ /

If with heartfelt devotion one venerates and prays, There is no doubt one will be blessed. So fortunate beings who have entered the Vajrayāna Must be diligent in this, the best of all dharma practices.
bsod nams 'di yis bdag dang 'gro ba kun/ / thog med 'khrul pa skad cig nyid la sangs/ / lhan skyes ye shes nyi ma khong nas shar/ / grub mchog rnams dang dbyer med nyid gyur cig /
By this merit may I and all beings Instantly cleanse our beginningless delusion. May the sun of coemergent gnosis rise from within, And may we be inseparable from the supreme siddhas.

ces pa 'di nyid mkhyen bla ma rin po che 'jam dbyangs mkhyen brtse'i dbang pos bka' stsal phebs pa dang*/ rang nyid kyang 'brel 'jog tshogs gsog gi cha rkyen du dmigs te mchod phreng sogs kyi tshig sbyor phal mo che sngon rabs dam pa rnams kyi gsung byin rlabs can dang bsdebs te/ ku sA li karma ngag dbang yon tan rgya mtsho phrin las kun khyab dpal bzang pos rdzong gsar bkra shis lha rtse'i chos grwar bkod pa

At the request of the omniscient precious teacher Jamyang Khyentse Wangpo, and in consideration of its being a good occasion for making connections and accumulating merit, I, the beggar Karma Ngawang Yönten Gyatso Trinle Kunkhyap Palzangpo, wrote this in the dharma college of Tashi Lhatse at Dzongsar, splicing together mostly compositions such as offering liturgies and the blessed writings of the holy beings of the past.
dge legs 'phel// //
May virtue and excellence increase.
@#/ /grub mchog spyi la brten pa'i bla ma'i rnal 'byor rgya gar lugs dngos grub thig le 'khyil ba bzhugs so/ /
4. COLLECTING THE ESSENCE DROPS OF ACCOMPLISHMENT. A Universally Applicable Guru Yoga on the Supreme Siddhas, according to the Indian Tradition[1]
@#/ /na mo gu ru ma hA sid+d+hi la b+d+he b+h+yaH
{134} namo guru mahāsiddha labedha bhya

rnam rtog la brten mi rtog brnyes/ / mi rtog khong nas ye shes shar/ / zung 'jug grub pa mchog rnams dang*/ / dbyer med rdo rje 'dzin la 'dud/ / bla ma'i rim pa las 'ongs pa/ / byin rlabs 'jug pa'i thabs zab mo/ / grub thob brgyud pa'i zhal lung ltar/ / rang rtog 'khrul dris ma bslad dgod/ /

On the basis of thought, they attained no-thought, And from within no-thought, their gnosis dawned. To the vajra holder, who is inseparable from Those supreme beings who attained the union state, I bow. I will write a profound method for receiving the blessings That come from the succession of teachers, In accordance with the oral instructions of the lineage siddhas And uncorrupted by the stains of deluded thoughts.

grub pa'i spyi mes chen po slob dpon rta mchog zhabs dang*/ rtsod dus kyi dpal he ru ka zhi ba sbas pa'i gdams ngag gis bka' srol ltar slob dpon dpa' bo 'od gsal lugs kyi grub thob brgyad cu rtsa bzhi gtso bor gyur pa'i grub chen gang la'ang sbyor du rung ba'i bla ma'i rnal 'byor nyams su len par 'dod pas/ dben pa'i gnas su maN+Dal gyi yo byad nye bar bsdog / 'byor na phyi nang gi mchod pa ji ltar rigs pa bshams la/ skyabs 'gro dang sems bskyed/ tshad med bzhi bsgoms pa rnams spyi ltar sngon du btang*/

The cult of the eighty-four most important siddhas founded by Āchārya Vīraprabhāsvara follows the tradition of oral instructions from the great siddhas of the past, Āchārya Paramāshvapāda and the glorious heruka of the age of strife, Shāntigupta. If you wish to practice a guru yoga that can be applied to any of these great siddhas, you should proceed as follows. In an isolated place, assemble the requisites for a mandala and set out suitable offerings (outer, inner, and secret) if you have them. Begin in the general fashion by taking refuge, arousing bodhichitta, and meditating on the four boundless attitudes.

maN+Dal byi dor byas la/ oM badz+ra b+hU mi swA hA/ zhes skyon sbyang*/ oM badz+ra re khe hU~M swA hA/ zhes dri bzang dang ba byung gis skyang nul bya/ de'i dbus su lag pa g.yas pas me tog gsar pa'i tshom bu bkod la/ hU~M su me ru ma d+h+ye ma/

Wipe clean the mandala plate, cleansing it of impurities as you say oṁ vajra bhūmi svāhā, and sprinkling it with scented water and the ingredients from a cow[2] as you say oṁ vajra rekhe hūṁ svāhā. With your right hand, place a heap of fresh flowers in the middle, saying hūṁ sumeru madhyema.
shar du bkod la/ ya sUrba bi de ha dwI ba/ lhor bkod la/ ra dzaM pu dwI pa dak+Shi NaH nub tu bkod la/ wa go da nI ya ba bash+tsa ma dwI pa/

Then place a heap to the east, saying, ya sūrva videhadvīpa; place a heap to the south, with ra jambudvīpa dakṣiṇaḥ; place one to the west with va godanīya vaścamadvīpa, and one to the north with la uttarakurudvīpa. {135}

byang du bkod la/ la urtar ku ru dI pa/ shar gyi g.yas g.yon du bkod/ yaM aHde hash+tsa bi de ha/ lho'i g.yas g.yon du bkod la/ raM raHtsa ma rash+tsa a pa tsa ma raH nub kyi g.yas g.yon du bkod la/ waM waHsha Sha urtar mat+t+ri NaH byang gi g.yas g.yon tu bkod la/ laM laHku ra wa ko ra wA/ shar gyi shar dang nub kyi nub tu bkod la/ tsan+d+ra sUr+Ya b+hUShi ta/ zhes brjod nas/

Next place heaps to the right and left of the eastern heap with yaṃ yaḥ dehaśca videha; to the right and left of the southern heap with raṃ raḥ camaraśca apacamaraḥ; to the right and left of the western heap with vaṃ vaḥ śaṣśaca uttara mattriṇaḥ; and to the right and left of the northern heap with laṃ laḥ kuravaṣca koravā. After that, place a heap to the east of the eastern pile and one to the west of the western pile, saying as you do so candra sūrya bhūṣita. Then pray:
rin chen sna tshogs rang bzhin ni/ / ri rab lcog brgyad yang dag ldan/ / gling bzhi gling phran ldan pa 'di/ / 'bul gyi yang dag bzhes su gsol/ / zhes me tog dor la maN+Dal mdun stegs su bkod/

This supreme mountain made of different precious substances, Adorned with eight turrets, And having four continents and the subcontinents I offer and pray you to accept. As you say this, scatter flowers, then place the mandala on the shrine in front.

maN+Dal gyi dbus su dag pa ye shes kyi zhing khams rgya dang tshad yongs su chad pa med pa rgyan bkod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang bcas pa phyi rol srung ba'i 'khor lo gzhom du med pas yongs su bskor ba'i snying por gzhal med khang rgyu dang bkod pa phun sum tshogs pa/ dur khrod rol pa'i yo byad dang lha rdzas kyi nyer spyod mtha' klas pas brgyan pa'i dbus su kr-iSh+Na sA ra'i pags pa'i gdan la rtsa ba'i bla ma dang gnyis su med pa'i grub pa'i dbang phyug dpal sa ra ha/

In the middle of the mandala is a pure wisdom buddha field of full dimensions and extent, perfect in its adornments and layout, surrounded by an impenetrable outer protection circle. In its center is a measureless palace of perfect materials and architecture, decorated with infinite charnel ground attributes and celestial offerings. In the center of the palace, seated upon an antelope skin, is the lord of accomplished beings, glorious Saraha, inseparable from my root teacher.

sku mdog dkar dmar bram ze'i cha byad can/ bgres rgud spangs pa'i lang tsho 'gyur ba med pa'i gang ba la rtag tu gnas pa/ dbu skra jo bregs ras dmar po'i ang+ga rag gsol zhing phyag gnyis gnyug ma'i gnas lugs mtshon par byed pa'i mda' srong ba'i phyag rgya can/ zhabs phyed skyil krung du bzhugs pa'i g.yon nas rig ma ye shes kyi rnal 'byor ma mda' mkhan mo'i tshul can gyis brten pa lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i ye shes gyi gzi 'od phyogs brgyar 'bar bas bzod par dka' ba'i zil can nyi ma'i snying po lta bu/ srid pa gsum zil gyis gnon pa'i lta stangs kyis rab tu dpa' ba'i nyams can/

He is white in color, tinged with red, and has the appearance of a brahmin. He has avoided becoming old and senile and remains eternally youthful. His hair is uncut, and he is wearing red cotton shorts. His two hands display the gesture of straightening an arrow, symbolizing the fundamental mode of existence. {136} He is sitting with his legs half-crossed. On his left he is accompanied by his spiritual consort, a wisdom yoginī in the guise of a huntress. Shining in a hundred directions with the radiance of the gnosis of coemergent great bliss, they are as dazzlingly brilliant as the very heart of the sun. With a gaze that overawes the three worlds, he has an appearance of intense spiritual power.
thugs gnyis su med pa'i ye shes phyag rgya chen po chos kyi sku la rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa/
His mind constantly rests in meditation in the state of nondual gnosis, the Great Seal, the body of truth.
lhun gyis grub cing rgyun mi chad pa'i phrin las kyi rnam par rol pa zad mi shes pa can/
He endlessly manifests a display of spontaneous, uninterrupted activities.
dpa' bo dang DA ki rgya mtsho lta bu'i mchod cing brjid pa dang*/ sa gsum gyi dbang po rnams kyi ri mor byed bzhin pa'i sku can gyi
Resplendent, he is venerated by infinite ḍākas and ḍākinīs and honored by the rulers of the three worlds.
spyi bor oM/ mgrin par AH thugs kar hU~M/ dam tshig pa dang ye shes pa gdod nas dbyer mi phyed pa/
In his crown center is the syllable oṁ, in his throat center the syllable āḥ, and in his heart center the syllable hūṁ. The meditation deity and wisdom deity are inseparable from the beginning.

dngos dang brgyud pa'i bla ma kun 'dus/ yi dam zhi khro rab 'byams kun 'dus/ sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun kun 'dus/ mkha' 'gro chos skyong srung ma kun 'dus/ / brtan g.yo'i khyab bdag / 'khor 'das kyi dpal mgon/ skyabs gnas kun gyi spyi gzugs chen por mngon sum du bzhugs par gyur/

He is the embodiment of all one’s present teachers and lineage teachers, The embodiment of all the infinite peaceful and wrathful yidam deities, The embodiment of the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha, The embodiment of all the ḍākinīs and dharma protectors and guardians, The all-pervading lord of the world and its inhabitants, The glorious protector of samsara and nirvana, The great, universal embodiment, in person, of all sources of refuge.
oM AHdpal ldan rdo rje bla ma dam pa'i zhabs kyi pad+mo yang dag pa'i ye shes gsal bar byed pa de la phyag 'tshal lo hU~M/ ad+ya sid+d+h+ya mAM/ zhes lan mang du phyag bya/
oṁ āḥ At the lotus feet of the supreme glorious vajra teacher who reveals the true gnosis I submit obeisance hūṁ adhya siddhā māṃ Saying this three times, make prostrations.
gang gi drin gyis bde chen nyid/ / skad cig nyid la 'char ba gang*/ / bla ma rin chen lta bu'i sku/ / mda' bsnun khyod zhabs pad la 'dud/ /
Through your kindness Great bliss arises in an instant: Teacher whose body is like a precious jewel, Saraha the Archer, at your lotus feet I bow down.
rgyal ba kun dngos bla ma la/ / dngos bshams yid sprul mchod pa'i sprin/ / sgo gsum longs spyod dge rtsar bcas/ / gus pas 'bul gyis bzhes su gsol/ /

To the teacher, who is all the buddhas come in person, Clouds of offerings, presented in reality and manifested in the imagination, And my three doors, possessions, and sources of good I respectfully offer and request you to accept.
nyon mongs dbang gyur thog med nas/ / sdig sgrib nyes ltung ci bsags par/ / gnong 'gyod drag pos snying nas bshags/ / dag cing tshangs pa'i dngos grub stsol/ /

Since time without beginning, under the sway of defilements, I have accumulated evil deeds, obscurations, faults, and downfalls. All these, with intense remorse, I confess from the depths of my heart. Purify them and bestow the accomplishment of purity. {137}
skye 'phags rgyal ba sras bcas kyis/ / zag bcas zag pa med pa yi/ / bsod nams gang bsags thams cad la/ / dga' ba chen pos rjes yi rang*/ /
With great joy, I rejoice In all the merit accumulated, Tainted and untainted, By ordinary and noble beings and the buddhas and their heirs.
zab dang rgya che'i chos kyi sgo/ / khyad par theg mchog bla na med/ / gdul bya'i khams dbang mos pa bzhin/ / rgyun chad med par ston par bskul/ /

I exhort you to teach unceasingly The ways to practice the dharma, profound and extensive, And especially the unsurpassed Supreme Vehicle, In accord with the characters, faculties, and aspirations of beings.
'khor ba'i 'khor lo ma zhig bar/ / de srid snying rje'i gzhan dbang gis/ / zhi ba'i dbyings su mi gzhol bar/ / rtag cing brtan par bzhugs gsol 'debs/ /
Until the wheel of samsara has been destroyed, Moved by compassion May you not enter the expanse of peace But stay here steadfast and forever, I pray.
'dis mtshon dus gsum dge ba'i mthus/ / myur du byang chub mchog thob nas/ / nam mkha' mnyam pa'i sems can rnams/ / srid pa'i mtsho las sgrol bar shog /
By the merit of this, representing all merit, past, present, and future, May I swiftly attain supreme enlightenment And free beings, as numberless as the sky is vast, From the ocean of existence.

ces yan lag bdun pa ci mang dang*/ thun mong gis maN+Dal spyi ltar rgyas bsdus lan mang du phul rjes nang gi maN+Dal ni/ skad cig gis ye shes kyi ral gri rno ngar dang ldan pa lag tu byung*/ des rang lus dum bur byas nas maN+Dal du bkod par gyur/

Perform these branches as many times as you can and offer the common mandala in the usual way, either detailed or condensed, many times. After that, make the inner mandala offering. As you set out the piles, consider that: In an instant the sharp sword of gnosis appears in my hand, And with it I cut my own body into pieces and present them as a mandala.

hU~M masta ka su me ru ya bA ma bA da bi de haH ra hi ni pA da dzam+pu dwI pa/ a pash+tsi ma dwI pa hi na ha sta/ la bA ma hasta ku ru urta ra/ shUtra ku su ma tsan+d+ra sUr+Ya b+hU Shi taM/ zhes tshom bu bkod par mos la/ i daM gu ru rat+na At+ma naM kA ya maN+Dal nir+Ya ta yA mi/ zhes dbul zhing

hūṁ mastaka sumeru yavā mavāda videhaḥ rahi nipāda jambudvīpa va paści madvīpa hina hasta la vāma hasta kuru uttara śūtra kusuma candra sūrya bhūṣri taṃ Offer the mandala, saying: idaṃ guru ratna ātmanaṃ kāya maṇḍala niryata yāmi
slar yang*/ rang lus rnam smin phung po'i ka pA la/ / lings skyis phog dbus lhag ma'i lus phung rnams/ / ril por bcug la yi ge 'bru gsum gyis/ / sbyangs rtogs spar zhu bdud rtsi'i rgya mtshor gyur/ /

Again, Into the skull cup severed from my own body (the aggregates of my ripened karma) Are inserted all my remaining aggregates, And with the three syllables, they are purified, Transformed, and magnified, melting into an ocean of nectar.

oM AHhU~M ha ho hrIH lan gsum du brjod/ ljags rdo rje'i 'od zer gyi sbu gus gsol bar gyur par bsam la/ zhal zas ro brgya ldan pa'i yid 'phrog pa/ / legs sbyar 'di ni dpal ldan bla ma la/ / dad pas phul bas 'gro ba 'di dag kun/ / 'byor ldan ting 'dzin zas la spyod par shog /

Say oṁ āḥ hūṁ ha ho hrīḥ three times. Consider that: [The teacher] drinks it through his tongue—a vajra-shaped tube of light. Then: This deliciously prepared food offering, Bewitching with its hundred tastes, I offer with faith to the glorious teacher. May all these beings have the fortune to enjoy the food of concentration.
oM AHshrI mA na sang+gu ru ma hrA sid+d+hi mA na sa ra ha sa pa ri wA ri b+h+yaH i daM ba li ga Na tsakra ma hA pU dza khA hi/ sarba sid+d+hi m+me pra yats+tshan+tu/
oṁ āḥ śrī māna sadguru mahā siddhi māna saraha sapari vāre bhyaḥ idam bali gaṇacakra mahā pūja khā hi sarva siddhi mem prayacchantu

'dir phyi nang gi mchod pa ci 'byor bas mchod par bgyi gsungs pas rgyas par spro na mchod phreng gi tshig ci rigs sbyar/ dkyus su/ yang dag dga' ba'i me tog gis/ / rdo rje nyi ma pad+mar byung*/ / me tog bdag nyid la mchod pa/ / rdo rje gsum gyi bdag nyid mchog / puSh+pe sogs sbyar/

At this point, the original text[3] states that one should make whatever outer and inner offerings one has, {138} so if you wish to make detailed offerings, use any suitable verses from an offering liturgy. Otherwise, continue as follows, making the offerings with puṣpe and so on:[4] With the flower of authentic joy The vajra sun is drawn into the lotus And offered to the sovereign of the flower, The supreme nature of the three vajras.
rnam rtog tshogs kyi yul min cing*/ / lte bar gtum mo 'bar ba yis/ / nges par sregs pa de yi spos/ / thugs kyi rdo rje la ni dbul/ /
Conceptual thoughts, not being objects of the sense consciousnesses, Are burned up by the blazing mystic heat in the navel: The smell of incense as they burn I offer to the vajra mind.
yi ge hU~M las yang dag byung*/ / sngags kyi 'od zer shin tu gsal/ / mar me 'bar ba'i yang dag 'od/ / thugs kyi rdo rje la dbul bya/ /
The pure light of shining lamps, The brilliant rays of light of the mantra Arising from the syllable hūṁ, Is offered to the vajra mind.
bde ba chen po'i nam mkhar gnas/ / byang chub sems ni sad pa dang*/ / de nyid kyis kyang byugs pa ni/ / thugs kyi rdo rje la dbul bya/ /
The state of resting in the expanse of great bliss Is anointed with the awakening of bodhichitta And with thatness: That perfume is offered to the vajra mind.
'dir ni gang dang gang longs spyod/ / dbang po thams cad yang dag bstan/ / de dag thams cad thugs rdo rje/ / bza' ba'i mchod pas mchod par bya/ /
The enjoyment of everything here Is the true display of the senses. All these are the vajra mind, Offered as the offering of food.
'gog pa'i rdo rjer gugs pa'i sems/ / rang nyams dpyid kyi dpa' bo'i glu/ / gzhom med na dA'i sgra dbyangs kyis/ / thugs kyi rdo rje'i mchod par bgyi/ /
With the mind focused on the vajra cessation, The sweet melody of indestructible sound, The cuckoo’s call of one’s own experience, I make the offering of the vajra mind.

nang mchod bdud rtsi phul la/ oM AHhU~M/ bdud rtsi lnga yi bza' ba ni/ / dngos grub kun gyi de nyid mchog / sgron ma lnga yi bza' ba ni/ / sangs rgyas kun gyi dam tshig gtso/ / nyes bral zhi ba'i btung ba mchog / sbrang rtsi bu ram 'bru dang shing*/ / bcos pa'i myos byed rnam pa lnga/ / shes rab rang bzhin dbul bar bgyi/ /

To offer the nectar of the inner offering: oṁ āḥ hūṁ The food of the five nectars, The supreme nature of all accomplishments; The food of the five meats, The principal samaya of all the buddhas; The sublime and flawless drink of peace, The five intoxicating liquors (mead, sugarcane beer, Grain beer, fruit wine, and processed alcohol)— All these, which have the nature of wisdom, I offer.
mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rig ma phul bar mos la/
Considering that you are offering authentic wisdom consorts, make the secret offering:

lha mo 'di dag phyag rgya che/ / mtha' yas bde ba sbyin pa mo/ / rigs lnga las byung 'di phul bas/ / rig pa'i brtul zhugs mthar phyin shog / lha dang mi yi bde ba ni/ / bsdus byas rdo rje 'dzin pa yi/ / bcu drug char yang mi phod pa'i/ / dga' ba bla na med pas mchod/ /

These goddesses, great mudrās, Who confer infinite bliss, Born from the five families, I offer: May I perfect the yogic practice of awareness. The sum of all the bliss of gods and humans Could never equal just a sixteenth part Of a vajra holder’s unsurpassed bliss, Which I now offer.
ces gsang ba'i mchod pa bya/ bstod pa grub chen so so'i sngags brjod bye brag pa sogs gang shes dang*/ spyi tsam du/
For the praise, recite any specific prayers of praise that you know for the relevant mahāsiddha, and as a general prayer recite the following:
zab zhi spros dang bral ba gnyug ma'i don/ / snang dang stong pa gnyis dang gnyis min la/ / e ma ho 'di snyam bral ba'i lta ba can/ / bde chen lhan skyes rol pa khyed la 'dud/ /

The meaning of the natural state, profound, peaceful, unelaborate, Is both appearance and emptiness and neither. Wonder! You hold the view free of thinking “This is it.” {139} Display of coemergent great bliss, to you we bow.
smra bsam brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin la/ / bde stong 'dzin pa med pa bde ba'i nyams/ / e ma ho rtsol bral lhug ma'i sgom pa can/ / bde chen lhan skyes rol pa khyed la 'dud/ /

The inexpressible, inconceivable nature Is the experience of bliss, bliss-emptiness devoid of grasping. Wonder! You stay in relaxed meditation, free of effort. Display of coemergent great bliss, to you we bow.
spang blang byar med rang bzhin 'od gsal la/ / gzung 'dzin glo bur dri ma rnam dag pa/ / e ma ho rang bzhin lhun grub 'bras bu can/ / bde chen lhan skyes rol pa khyed la 'dud/ /

The radiant nature free of the activity of avoidance or adoption Is pure and free from the adventitious stains of dualistic beliefs. Wonder! You hold the fruit, the spontaneously present nature. Display of coemergent great bliss, to you we bow.
ces pa tsam bya/ slar yang yan lag bdun pa bya bar gsungs pas rgyas bsdus gang lcogs sbyor chog / dkyus tsam du/
Again, the original text states that one should perform the seven branches, so you may insert detailed or condensed versions as appropriate. Otherwise simply continue with this:
oM AHdpal ldan rdo rje bla ma dam pa'i zhabs kyi pad+mo yang dag pa'i ye shes gsal bar byed pa de la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
oṁ āḥ I submit obeisance at the lotus feet of the supreme glorious vajra teacher, who reveals true gnosis.
hU~M/ byang chub snying po mchis kyi bar/ / bla ma sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal/ / skyobs pa chos la phyag 'tshal lo/ / dge 'dun rje la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
hūṁ Until I reach the heart of enlightenment, I pay homage to the teacher, the Buddha. I pay homage to the protector, the dharma. I pay homage to the venerable sangha.
phyag 'os sangs rgyas thams cad dang*/ / rgyal bas gsungs pa'i chos rnams dang*/ / tshul khrims bzang ldan dge 'dun ste/ / dkon mchog gsum la bdag skyabs mchi/ /
To all the buddhas, worthy of homage, To the teachings given by the victorious ones, And to the sangha possessed of excellent discipline— To the Three Jewels I go for refuge.
byas dang byed du bcug dang yi rang ba'i/ / sdig pa ma lus skyon kun 'jig byed pa'i/ / spyan lngar so sor bshags shing slar yang ni/ / mi byed pa yi sdom pa blang bar bgyi/ /

All the negative deeds without exception That I have committed, induced others to do, and rejoiced in— I confess each one in the presence of those who destroy all faults, And I take the vow not to commit them again.
nyan thos rang rgyal bla med rgyal ba dang*/ / rgyal ba'i sras kyis dge ba gang mdzad pa/ / de dag kun la yang dag yi rangs shing*/ / byang chub tu ni yongs su bsngo bar bgyi/ /
I truly rejoice in all the virtue performed By the listeners, solitary realizers, Unsurpassed buddhas, and bodhisattvas, And I dedicate it all to enlightenment.
rgyal ba dkon mchog la sogs gsum po la/ / dngos po kun gyis bdag ni skyabs su mchi/ / byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed de bzhin du/ / bla na med pa'i lam la brten par bgyi/ /
In the Three Jewels, the precious buddhas and the others, I take refuge by every means. I arouse the mind set on supreme enlightenment, And likewise I will follow the unsurpassed path.
bdag gis dus gsum dge ba ci spyad pas/ / nam mkha'i mtha' klas gyur pa'i sems can rnams/ / bla med rdo rje theg pa'i snod gyur te/ / kun kyang rdo rje 'dzin pa myur thob shog /

As a result of all the virtue that I have performed in the three times, May beings as infinite as space Become vessels for the unsurpassed Vajrayāna And may they all swiftly attain the level of Vajradhara.

ces pa tsam bya/ de nas/ At+ma naM su kha duHkha te me dz+nyA ne su kha ki duHkha to ma thi/ nas+thi sa ra ha na mo stu te/ zhes pa'am bod skad du bsgyur na/ bdag gis bde sdug khyed kyis mkhyen no/ / bde'am sdug kyang khyod las gzhan ma mchis so/ / phyag 'tshal zhing 'dud do sa ra ha/ / zhes pa gang rigs kyis drag tu gsol ba gdab cing*/

Next, pray fervently with whichever words are appropriate, either: ātmanaṃ sukha duḥkhate me jñāne sukha kiduḥkha tomathi {140} nasthi saraha namo stuti or, in English translation: You know all my joys and sorrows. In joy or pain, I have no one but you. To you, Saraha, I bow down in homage. And:
gu ru sha ra NaM gats+tsha mi/ lan mang du brjod/ oM AHma hA sid+d+hi la b+d+ha sa ra ha pA da hU~M hU~M/ zhes pa'i mtshan sngags kyang ci nus su bzla zhing*/
guru śaranaṃ gacchami Repeat this many times. Recite the name mantra as many times as you can: oṁ āḥ mahāsiddha labdha saraha pāda hūṁ hūṁ

mthar/ bla ma grub brnyes rnal 'byor dbang phyug gi / sku la rtsa gsum 'khor lo lnga gsal ba'i/ / g.yon phyogs rkyang ma dang bral kun+da'i khams/ / sku yi byin rlabs bdud rtsi 'od dkar tshul/ / smin mtshams nas byung rang gi dpral bar thim/ /

At the end, consider that: In the body of the teacher, the lord of yogis who has gained accomplishment, I visualize the three channels and five chakras. The male essence associated with the kyangma on the left side, The nectar of the blessings of the body in the form of white light, Issues from between the teacher’s eyebrows and dissolves into my own forehead.
lus kyi sgrib dag bum dbang thob par gyur/ / g.yas phyogs ro ma dang 'brel rdul gyi khams/ / gsung gi bdud rtsi 'od dmar tshul du byung*/ / mgul ba'i gnas nas bdag gi mgrin par thim/ /

The obscurations of the body are purified, and I receive the vase empowerment. The female essence associated with the roma on the right side, The nectar of the speech in the form of red light, Issues from the throat center and dissolves into my own throat.

ngag gi sgrib dag gsang ba'i dbang bskur thob/ / a wa d+hU ti mun can dngas ma'i tshul/ / thugs kyi byin rlabs bdud rtsi 'od mthing bcas/ / thugs ka'i gnas nas snying gar thim pa yis/ / yid kyi sgrib dag sher dbang ye shes thob/ / bla ma 'od du zhu nas rang la thim/ /

The obscurations of speech are purified, and I receive the secret empowerment. The blessings of mind in the form of the dark essence associated with the central channel, Nectar in the form of deep-blue light, Issues from the heart center and dissolves into my own heart. The obscurations of mind are purified, and I gain the gnosis of the wisdom empowerment. The teacher melts into light and dissolves into me.
gnyis med bsam brjod bral ba'i ngang du bzhag / sgo gsum 'pho ba'i sgrib dag tshig dbang thob/ / bla ma rang sems tha mi dad du 'dres/ /

I rest in the nondual state beyond thought and word. The most subtle obscurations of the three doors are purified, and I receive the word empowerment. The teacher and my own mind are mingled indistinguishably.
